campaign.story:
The Lost Empire of the Moon is an epic all-ages tale of action and adventure written and drawn by Sean Hall. The seven-book series, the first three of which are collected in this sumptuous hardback Artithmeric Edition, took Sean five years almost to the day to complete and gained avid followers worldwide as its chapters were published page by page as a live webcomic while they were being developed.
Dirk Brodey and his sidekick Tad are freelance adventurers in a world of cowboys, magic and monsters in which Dirk owns his very own futuristic flying ship that is capable of flying to the moon and back whenever needed. A fantastic world of Sean’s devising which is strangely real to the protagonists and readers.
In this rip-roaring adventure, Dirk and Tad are hired to find the lost Moon Pearl, but soon find they’ll have to battle the forces of the entire Merling Kingdom to get it!
Sean Hall is both a compelling storyteller and a distinctive artist. He is producing classic work in the field of the 9th Art that will stand the test of time. In that way he is, in our humble opinion, one of the true heirs of Hergé, Bob de Moor and Edgar P Jacobs. He is the genuine article.
This Kickstarter campaign offers you the chance of supporting his mercurial talent by buying his book, and even becoming an Angel Backer of his first important work and owning limited edition signed prints and, for the lucky few, original signed drawings by the artist.

Front cover of the Graphic Novel
The hard back graphic novel of the first three Dirk Brodey stories; the Lost Empire of the Moon episodes 1, 2 & 3.
This Artithmeric Edition beautifully printed in full colour, hard cover and matt laminated. 88 pages. Book size 290cm x 220cm. It is exclusively available on Kickstarter.

Fine art prints
These frameable, signed and numbered fine-art prints are available exclusively to the Angel Backers of this Artithmeric Edition. Each print is from a limited edition of just 10, with each numbered and hand-signed by Sean Hall.
These Giclée prints are museum-grade pieces on 270 gsm archival Hahnemulle fine-art paper and will fit in a standard A4 frame.

Original drawings
For a maximum of ten level 3 Angel Backers of this Artithmeric Edition of The Lost Empire of the Moon we have reserved a special additional reward. Each backer will get an original piece of Dirk Brodey artwork hand-drawn and signed by Sean Hall. These are shown above and will be allocated on a ‘first come, first choice’ basis.

T-shirt
High quality T-shirt available in sizes Small, Medium, Large, X-Large, XXL & XXXL.
Exclusively available from this Kickstarter campaign.

Comics

The comic books volumes 1, 2 & 3 of Dirk Brodey ’The Lost Empire of the Moon’ beautifully printed in full colour with 130 gsm silk paper covers and 80 gsm uncoated paper interior pages. In classic comic book size 168 x 260 mm.

We are huge fans of some of the other creators on Kickstarter and we'd love you to check out their pages and add your support. 
Ben Bender is the creator of BEORN: The Littlest Viking Saga, and with your help he's printing BOOK TWO of this all-ages adventure comedy! Click here to visit his page.

updates.update_content:
Thank you for completing our Kickstarter survey.

We are happy to say that all items are either in production or already produced and ready to send out to you during this month (June). You may have noticed our Kickstarter page mistakenly said that fulfilment would be in May 2021, but that was a drafting error on our part (which you probably will have already guessed given that the Kickstarter only finished on 26th May).

We are absolutely thrilled to have reached 50 backers and as a thank you to all those who have supported us, anyone who has ordered a printed copy of the comics or graphic novel, will now also receive a digital copy as well.
Thank you again for all the support.
Best Regards

Thank you so much to everyone who has helped fund our project. We were fully funded within 6 hours of launching, which is a phenomenal achievement. We'll keep you posted as our campaign progresses. 

As a thank you to all who signed up for any printed material, we'll now also include 5 exclusive Dirk Brodey postcards at no additional cost.

BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY needs your help to print our new story, THE BOOK OF DEMONS (41 page story in a 48 page perfect bound book) and produce our NEW PLAGUE DOCTOR LAPEL PIN!
Here's our cover:

Who will love Boston Metaphysical Society?
Fans of Penny Dreadful, Girl Genius, Ruse, steampunk and gaslamp fantasy stories.
People who like to read paranormal, historical fiction, and/or alternate history.
If you like character-driven comics with a mix of paranormal and science fiction, then these are the comics for you!
THE STORY
When Erin, Caitlin’s mother, discovers her daughter can control a demon, she is outraged. In her mind, only a Great House has the right to such power, but who will listen to a poor Irish woman? House Lowell will. For Alice Lowell has inherited an old Puritan journal which describes how to find and enslave a demon, but she needs a psychic to do it. Kidnapping Caitlin is the first step in a plan to rid her husband’s House of debt. But with a demon to do their bidding, her ambitions will be limitless.
The Book of Demons can be read as a standalone, but it is a continuation of Ghosts and Demons.
First Three Pages:
NEW TO BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY?
If you are new to the series, the original six issue mini-series is about an ex-Pinkerton detective, a spirit photographer, and a genius scientist who battle supernatural forces in late 1800’s Boston. They  live in an alternate steampunk history where ghosts and demons are a normal part of life. Families known as the Great Houses control the economy of the Great States of America while the middle class and lower classes sole purpose are to serve the Great Houses.
The original trade paperback is available in several reward tiers.
WHAT'S IN THE TRADE?
I'm glad you asked. Not only does it include all six issues from the  original mini-series as well as the cover art, but it also contains a  ten page  short story called, Hunter-Killer,  and additional bonus pages. With art by Emily Hu and coloring by Gloria Caeli, the story is set at the beginning of the House Wars (my version of the American Civil War) and features the crew of a prototype airship.  I introduce three new characters: Gwen Warrick - Captain;  Emmet Rochester - Navigator; and Joaquin Medina - Engineer.
The complete sequential art version of Hunter-Killer will ONLY be available in the trade.
WHAT ELSE IS THERE?
Our three previous standalone sequels will be available as well. And they are:
THE SCOURGE OF THE MECHANICAL MEN 
STORY: Granville and Tesla are in a race for time to save Boston from a mysterious disease that turns human beings into machines.

THE SPIRIT OF REBELLION 
 STORY: Caitlin flees to Philadelphia only to discover a ghost, a rebellion, and perhaps, her destiny.

GHOSTS AND DEMONS 
 STORY:  A disturbing dream leads Caitlin and the team to face off with a new enemy.
THE BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY COLORING BOOK:
Twenty (20) gorgeous illustrations for you to relax  and color away to your heart's content. Includes illustrations of  Samuel, Granville, Caitlin, Tesla, Houdini, and more! It will be an 8  1/2 x 11 book and is suitable for all ages. Art by Alejandro Lee
OTHER REWARDS
In addition to THE BOOK OF DEMONS, we are offering the trade paperback, the anthology Boston Metaphysical Society: Prelude, the first novel set in this universe, Boston Metaphysical Society: A Storm of Secrets, plus a NEW PLAGUE DOCTOR LAPEL PIN. It is 1 inch in diameter and will be an antique bronze color. (Designed by Alejandro Lee.)
Lapel Pin Set
A set of SEVEN Boston Metaphysical pins (Plague Doctor, Bowler Hat, Teapot, Dirigible, Tesla, 1800's Box Camera, and Triquetra) in a lovely gift box with our logo are available as well. (As long as supplies last.)
BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY: A STORM OF SECRETS
The award winning novel, BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY: A STORM OF SECRETS, is a prequel to the original graphic novel though it can be read as a standalone. It takes place five years prior to the original series.
It was awarded a Silver Medal as well as The Write Companion Award for Best Overall TOP PICK - Adult, Children's and Young Adult categories in the 2019 Feathered Quill Book Awards.
Story: As the Great Houses of Boston jockey for power, an ex-Pinkerton detective, his psychic wife, and his father-in-law must contend with treachery, subterfuge, and a new supernatural threat, in this political and supernatural thriller set in an alternate-history Boston of 1890.
The award winning cover is by Luisa Preissler. Title Graphics by Anke Koopman.

And if you haven't read Boston Metaphysical Society: Prelude yet, then this would be the perfect time to get it. This anthology of short stories and novellas includes stories of how Granville and Samuel met and their first case together; what set Caitlin on her path; and how Samuel met his wife, Elizabeth Weldsmore Hunter. Several reward tiers  include it as either a pdf or print version.
The Underground - A Boston Metaphysical Society Short Story (Available as an Add-on for all tiers and is already included in the Granville Woods and All Things BMS tiers.) 
In The Underground,  Andrew O'Sullivan takes his young daughter, Caitlin, on a case that might reveal a past and a potential future neither of them expected. This is a prose story and is available in Epub or mobi formats. (Previously published in Last Stop on the #13.)
NEW REWARD TIER!
SPECIAL COMMISSION REWARD TIER (KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE)
Ever wanted to time travel? This will be the closest you’ll ever come when our fabulous artist Gwynn Tavares draws you into the illustration with the Granville and Alma (See image) in period costume. This will be an 11 x 17 inch poster on 80 lb. Classic Stripple. She’s only doing five, so jump on this now before they are gone.
 THE MONEY: 
SHIPPING:
Shipping last year was a challenge.  My stalwart shipping envelopes met their match at USPS, so this year I will be using the ULINE S-165 cardboard mailers (or their equivalent) along with boards and extra packing material for anything outside of California (and probably in California as well.) Those who order the Nothing But Books and All Things BMS will get the usual sturdy cardboard box as those have worked well in the past.
INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING: We were able to obtain discounted international postage for over 55 countries this year. I have passed on those savings to you depending on your shipping address. To extend these savings even further, for those who pledge to the Nothing But Books or the All Things BMS, and it is shipped to one of those 55 countries, we will be splitting up the rewards into two boxes in order for you to receive the discount. 
THE TEAM FOR THE SEQUELS:
Madeleine Holly-Rosing - Writer/Creator: A   TV, feature film, comic book writer, and novelist, Madeleine holds an   MFA in Screenwriting from UCLA where she won numerous awards as well as  the Sloan Fellowship. Madeleine has published a number of short stories, novellas, and a novel based on the BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY universe. Other comic projects include the short story, The Scout which is part of The 4th Monkey anthology, The Sanctuary (The Edgar Allan Poe Chronicles anthology), The Marriage Counselor (The Cthulhu is Hard to Spell anthology), The Glob (Night Wolf Vol. 1), Infinity Tree (Menagerie: Declassified) and the upcoming The Airship Pirate (The Rum Row anthology), and The Birth (Stan Yak Vampire Anthology).
Gwynn Tavares – Artist/Colorist: Gwynn started out her art career as a sculptor. After a few years working on   movie special effects, she decided to go into sequential art and was  the  artist for Amelia Sky. Majoring as in illustrator, Gwynn is also an  accomplished comedian and currently lives in France.
Troy Peteri – Letterer: Troy is a Los   Angeles based letterer whose credits include AMAZING SPIDER-MAN, IRON   MAN, and roughly 98% of all the comics from Top Cow Productions for the   last 6+ years. He also co-wrote and lettered ABATTOIR, a mini-series  for  Radical Comics.
THE TEAM FOR BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY TRADE PAPERBACK:
Madeleine Holly-Rosing, Writer/Creator. (See credits above.)
Emily Hu – Artist: Emily is a graduate from   the School of Visual Arts in New York City. She has been drawing ever   since she was little and it's been her lifelong dream to make it as a   comic book artist. Her main influences are Eduardo Risso, Becky  Cloonan,  and Ito Junji. She works freelance and has created covers for  BOOM!  BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is her first comic book series. Emily  is  currently doing storyboards for Nickelodeon.
Gloria Caeli – Colorist: Based in Jakarta,   she has worked for Avicom Advertising and Stellar Labs. Her most recent   projects are BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY and VOODOO. She like anyone   else enjoys music, photography, travelling, and reads a lot of genre   related books.
Fahriza Kamaputra – Colorist:  Based in  Jakarta, Fahriza is a self-taught comics and concept artist.  He worked  as a colorist on VIENETTA AND THE STUPID ALIENS which led to  his work on  he webcomic ROKKI with Stellar Labs. His current work  includes Bob  Salley's, Salvagers and Shelter Division.
Shawn Aldridge (Letterer – Chapter 4) Shawn   Aldridge is a Portland based writer and letterer. He’s best known for   his awarding winning creator-owned sci-pulp series, VIC BOONE. He also   writes and co-created GoGetters from MonkeyBrain with artist  Christopher  Peterson. His work has also appeared in FUBAR, the NYT  bestselling  anthology series.
Troy Peteri – Letterer (Chapters 1-3, 5 and 6) (See credits above.)

The graphic novel was nominated for Best Comic/Graphic Novel at the 2014 Geekie Awards.
WHAT OTHER PEOPLE SAY
"Women and people of color take center stage in the Boston   Metaphysical Society comic, written by Madeline Holly-Rosing, with art   by Emily Hu. Inspired by fantasy and the art of storytelling,   Holly-Rosing uses her imagination to create a fantastic story that is   both well-written and fearless." - Valerie Complex (Fansided)
"If you have a taste for an intelligent, well written, elegantly   illustrated award winning independent book, you can't go wrong with   Boston Metaphysical Society!" - Alex Yarde (The Good Man Project)
"This very inventive series posits a totally believable Steampunk   world that is populated by appealing characters who act (and react) in   believable manners to the extraordinary events that swirl around them."  -  Robert Sodaro (Comic Reviewer at Examiner.com)
THE STORY BEHIND THE STORY
I love writing BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY.  Not only does it bring my  love of science fiction and history  together, (which by the way, equals  steampunk), the steampunk time  period allows me to address the themes  of classism, sexism, and racism  in America in a thoughtful and engaging  way. For at its very core,  BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is an American  story. And you can't tell an  American story without including women and  people of color.
It has been and always will be important to me to write characters  who, though they come from diverse backgrounds and have different  points  of view, are able to work together for the common good.
ADD-ONS
I have decided not to use the option of Kickstarter add-ons during this campaign, though I will be using Backerkit when I send out the surveys if you'd like to add anything to your pledge.

The Tutorials Books
How to THINK when you DRAW volumes 1 - 4  are each 200 page full colour hardback books measuring 8.5" by 8.5". The books collect together MASSES of my drawing tutorials, covering an enormous range of subjects. The series is EXTREMELY user-friendly, designed to benefit every skill level, from the absolute beginner to the seasoned professional. BOOKS 1 - 3 have previously raised close to 2 million dollars on Kickstarter, with volume 3 becoming THE MOST SUCCESSFUL ART BOOK OF ALL-TIME on KICKSTARTER. Volumes 1 - 3 have been completely sold out since our last campaign. BOOK 4 is BRAND NEW and being launched exclusively here. These books will NOT be available ANYWHERE ELSE ONLINE OR IN SHOPS outside of Kickstarter for at least the next two years - they are ONLY AVAILABLE ON KICKSTARTER. The tutorials are better seen than described, so GO HERE FOR 300 FREE TUTORIALS.
The Deluxe Collection TRILOGY
The Deluxe Collection Parts 1 - 3  are each 600 page softcover black and white books measuring 8.5" by 8.5". The artwork is divided into chapters themed around character design, pose and gesture sheets, monsters, robots, concept vehicles, environment design, world building and much more. Each book features THOUSANDS of illustrations.
The Art of Stranski
The Art of Stranski is a 100 page full colour hardback book measuring 12" by 8.5". The book has raised well over £100,000 in Kickstarter campaigns and has been sold out for 12 months. We're offering you another chance to get it. This book will NOT be available ANYWHERE ELSE ONLINE OR IN SHOPS outside of Kickstarter for at least the next TWO YEARS - it is EXCLUSIVELY ONLY AVAILABLE HERE ON KICKSTARTER. To learn all about the book, just visit THE ORIGINAL STRANSKI CAMPAIGN HERE.
The WRITING Tutorials Book 
How to THINK when you WRITE is my brother Robin's 200 page full colour hardback book measuring 8.5" by 8.5". The book gathers together two years of writing tutorials, tackling an enormous range of subjects. Created as a companion to the How to THINK when you DRAW series, the vast array of subjects are designed to benefit creators of all skill levels, from writers wrangling their first plot to the seasoned scribe. The book has raised close to half a million dollars  in our previous Kickstarters, and has been sold out since our last campaign. This book will NOT be available ANYWHERE ELSE ONLINE OR IN SHOPS this year - it is ONLY AVAILABLE ON KICKSTARTER. These tutorials are better seen than described, so GO HERE FOR 225 FREE WRITING TUTORIALS.
Shipping costs
For UK customers there is a small postal charge. If you live outside the UK you'll need to add a shipping cost when you pledge, as detailed when you click the pledge boxes. I'm sorry it's expensive, but these books are HEAVY. The top tiers especially are exceptionally heavy, and will be shipped in dual packages, in order to better protect your books.
A huge thank you for taking the time to watch the video and check out the campaign, you can find out more about me and my work HERE.
Now just scroll down to choose your rewards...

campaign.story:
Hail to the King, baby

WHAT IF JACK KIRBY CREATED DRACULA? 
The result would have been terrifying, cosmic, and absolutely epic in scale. In other words, it would be a whole lot like... 
WHAT IS THE SOLAVORE?
The Eater of Dawns
Like a vampire needs blood, so the ancient evil known as THE SOLAVORE needs the energy of a sun. Absent for centuries from the far-off galaxy of the Morrigen people, the Solavore had disappeared into the realm of myth. But now, with one of their solar systems facing a cosmic loss, the Morrigen are learning that the Solavore is not only real... but hungry.

 WHO IS HUNTING IT? 
For years, the Galactic Kingdom of the Morrigen had been protected by its latest ruler, the brave and brilliant KING THEOSIS. Committed to the freedom and safety of his people, King Theosis has lead the Morrigen through decades of darkness, striving toward a future of progress and peace. But after so many battles, Theosis's beard has gone white; the grip on his sword has grown weaker.  And after a devastating personal loss, Theosis must summon a strength he's never known to defeat the worst threat the Morrigen have ever seen.
Fortunately for Theosis, his husband ABBINOIR will be there to help. Wise and compassionate as any ruler his people have served, Abbinoir is Theosis's personal strength. While the king is looking out for the kingdom, Abbinoir looks out for its king. And though he's been doing it for all of Theosis's reign, every new threat weighs more on his mind, none more so than the Solavore. After all, how can you protect a man who must protect a kingdom?
Not that he won't have help. In facing this unheard-of crisis, Theosis will have at his command some of the best warriors in the entire galaxy: his own royal guard and the elite female warriors known as the VALKINAE. Together, they make up the best defense the Morrigen have.
But will they be enough?

SNEAK PREVIEW
Check out some of the (not finalized) pages of HUNT FOR THE SOLAVORE.
(Pages not final)
(Pages not final)
(Pages not final)
 WHO IS CREATING HUNT FOR THE SOLAVORE? 
LANE LLOYD - Creator of the weird and zany, Lane is an up and coming artist with an energetic, off the wall style. After being featured on Comic Book Yeti, Outright Geekery, and The Driving Creators Network, Lane's comic GOD-PUNCHER smashed its way onto Kickstarter, receiving more than double the projected amount of funding.  With HUNT FOR THE SOLAVORE, Lane uses their skill of designing strange, larger-than-life characters to tell a story that's both firmly planted in the horror genre and stretched to the outer limits of science fiction.
GRANT DeARMITT - Grant's tales of the sinister and strange have been published at Haw Creek Horror, Crystal Lake Publishing, and Black Hole Entertainment.  A lifelong fan of weird fiction and fantasy epics, Grant hopes HUNT FOR THE SOLAVORE will present the human side of cosmic terror; an otherworldly story that hits home.

WHY ARE THEY CREATING IT?
King Theosis's ship. For interplanetary travel... and beyond.
Lane and Grant have spent two years developing the shocking showdown of Theosis and the Solavore. They made this Kickstarter to bring that story to life in the form it deserves: the comic book format.  But there is another reason. 
HUNT FOR THE SOLAVORE is just one story of thousands set in this all-new universe that Lane and Grant have cooked up. Getting it created, printed, and into the hands of readers like yourself is the first step in telling those tales. We believe that comic fans are hungry for new worlds and new terrors, and we believe we have some great ones to offer.
So by backing this project, you're not just helping us make a comic. You're opening a door to another galaxy, and all the heroes and horrors that live there.

campaign.story:
Stretch Goals!
Thanks to all the generous support I've received so far it's time for some stretch goals!
 $3,100 - REACHED
Upgrading the card finish from the basic card finish to the BETA finish which is an ultra-smooth finish that allows cards to glide beautifully and effortlessly together aiding playing card performances such as magic tricks and cardistry.
 $3,800 - LOCKED
Upgrade the card stock from smooth card stock to linen card stock which is casino quality.
 $4,300 - LOCKED
Upgrade the tuck box to have a sealed base for the box.

When I think of mobsters, I think of gambling...
From the glittering and glamorous casinos of Las Vegas to the back-room poker games where they'll break your leg if you don't have the money to back up your play...mobsters and gambling are two of a kind.
The Dust Bunny Mafia comic has been running since 2012 and has over 700 individual comics in it's archive. Since their creation, these mafia bunnies have been featured in two full-length comic collections (Meet the Family and The Blind Tiger), several booklets (Based on a True Story Vol. 1-2), and have run amuck in countless comic anthology projects (Unlawful Good, Out of the Deep, Forgotten Histories...just to name a few). 
And yet, after all of these successful products, there's one project that really shows the true nature of the Dust Bunny Mafia outside of the comic book landscape, which has eluded me thus far: playing cards. With this Kickstarter, I plan to make that dream into a reality. 
Introducing Dust Bunny Mafia Playing Cards
This deck will be a 55 card, standard poker-sized deck of playing cards featuring 52 of my favorite Dust Bunny Mafia characters from the comics to complete the standard deck. 

This will be a limited edition print run for the deck. No more than 500 decks will be produced.
Here you'll find all 52 cards that complete the standard deck.
Deck Specifications
For the funding goal of $3,000, below are the playing card specifications. As stretch goals are unlocked, there will be chances to upgrade elements of the cards. The more funding that's raised, the better deck quality I will be able to produce.
 Card Stock: (S30) Standard Smooth
 Size of deck: 55 cards
 Print type: Full color print
 Finish: MPC game card finish
 Packaging: Custom Tuck Box (Unsealed) - Glossy
 Box seals: Custom seal

Joker Cards
Along with the standard deck there are 3 Joker cards. Two of the Jokers are by guest artists, which will be revealed during the campaign. 

The first guest artist Joker card is Floyd the Crow as drawn by Sean Luke, creator of the Zombie Raygun comic. You can find Sean Luke on Instagram, check out Zombie Raygun on Facebook, or pick up your own copy of Zombie Raygun on Indyplanet
The second guest artist joker card is by The Awkward Yeti (Nick Seluk)!
Nick Seluk is the creator of The Awkward Yeti, Heart and Brain, Medical Tales Retold, and Olo.
You can find Nick on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and Patreon.
The third, and final Joker card, is a Mobimal (Mobster animal) commission card.

***DOMESTIC U.S. SHIPPING INCLUDED***
What do people say about the Dust Bunny Mafia?
 ***READ BASED ON A TRUE STORY VOL. 1, A DUST BUNNY MAFIA MINI COMIC COLLECTION, FOR FREE BY CLICKING HERE. This is a great introduction into the Dust Bunny Mafia universe.***
Campaign Exclusives
Limited edition poker chip
Limited edition enamel pin
Limited edition signed deck
Hand-crocheted mobimal characters
Your mobimal (mobster animal) on the limited edition poker chip
Your mobimal (mobster animal) on the Joker card
Jimmy the Nose Enamel Pin
With this campaign, I will creating another enamel pin featuring everyone's favorite furry consigliere, Jimmy the Nose. This pin will be made with hard enamel and is 1.25" inches. This will be a limited edition pin, with only 100 of them being made. Any extras left over after the campaign is run will be added to my online store.
DBM Whiskey Glasses
With this campaign, I will be working with Gingee Girls Studio to create a limited run of Dust Bunny Mafia branded whiskey glasses. If you're going to play poker like a mobster, you've gotta have the appropriately branded drink-ware! Below is a mock-up of what I imagine the whiskey glass to look similar to. This is only a mock-up and is not finalized. 
(Design not finalized)
Make 100
With the Make 100 Kickstarter initiative, there is a limited tier specifically for autographed decks of cards. While I am aiming for a larger print run for the decks only 100 copies of the decks will be signed with a Silver Metallic Sharpie on the front of the box. All other decks produced in this campaign will be unsigned.

Where's the Money Going?
Bret "The Fedora" Juliano - Creator
Bret Juliano is a cartoonist and creator of the all ages Dust Bunny Mafia comic, which has over 700 comics in its archive and Mobimals. In late  2016, Bret published Meet the Family, a Dust Bunny Mafia comic  collection. In 2019, he successfully funded a Kickstarter for Based on a True Story,  a Dust Bunny Mafia mini comic collection. In 2020, Bret returned to Kickstarter to fund his second Dust Bunny Mafia collection, The Blind Tiger and the second volume of the Based on a True Story mini comic collection. His dust bunny mobsters have also been included in several anthologies including Unlawful Good, Forgotten Histories and Out of the Deep as part of the Let’s Make Comics: Chicago Collective. He is an avid consumer of mafia trivia, both fact and fiction, and a passionate collector of fedoras.

What about the rewards?
***DOMESTIC U.S. SHIPPING INCLUDED***

Add-on's
Catch up on limited edition poker chips from previous Dust Bunny Mafia Kickstarter campaigns by utilizing the Add-On menu after you confirm your pledge.

Milestone Bonus Gifts
For each of the major funding goals we pass (shown below), I will unlock a new Milestone Bonus Gift that will be automatically included in all backers rewards.

Backer Count Bonus
Just like the Milestone Bonus Gifts, for each of the major backer counts we reach, I will unlock more free stuff for all backers!

campaign.story:
As a kid growing up among the tall timbers of Oregon, I wanted to create a Western that takes place in the evergreen-covered mountains. It's 50 years later, I've had Oscar nominations and won Cannes Festival awards, and it's time to fulfill a boyhood dream.
Three years ago, I wrote out a storyboard about a slide guitar-playing cowboy named Slide who appears in a corrupt logging town (circa 1940's) to battle a pair of evil twins and save the village of Sourdough Creek.
SLIDE has villains, an old-time country music cowboy band, the Lucky Buck Saloon and Bordello, and a glorious Oregon backdrop (And it features a hero who, like me, plays the slide guitar.)
By raising our $77,800 minimum goal here on Kickstarter my team and I will be able to devote most of the next six months to SLIDE, with a completion date in 2022.
But I want to get SLIDE to you sooner.
We have a very ambitious $200,000 "stretch" goal that would allow us to complete SLIDE by this time next year - and wouldn't it be great to have a new animated film ready for our safe return to theaters!
I think you're going to love the rewards: Attend the New York City premiere of SLIDE; Take a private animation class with me, either via Zoom or (after the pandemic) in my NYC studio; And ALL backers at the $100 level or higher will see their name in the closing credits!
I'm also drawing the caricature of at least one backer who will get to play a Old West villain, have a speaking role, see their name in the closing credits, AND get an IMDb credit.
Best of all, on Dec. 18, 2020 we're sending out a survey to all of our backers, giving you the option of gifting one of our rewards in time for the holidays. We'll email a gift certificate for the reward you select to the recipient you designate.
One of the cool advantages of going to Kickstarter now, halfway through the production, is that we have a lot of clips and sequences to share.  Follow me on Facebook daily during the campaign as I do a drawing a day on camera so you can see how I create my characters and animation.
People call me the "King of Indie Animation" and I hope to capitalize on that moniker to give people an inside look at how I create my films - from the concept to the editing and music.  
Thanks for supporting independent animation, and a sincere thanks for supporting me and my new film SLIDE with your generous pledge.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As an independent filmmaker, being self-financed is a risk all by itself. I animate a few commercial projects each year, recently a few cool music videos and an nearly-annual "couch gag" for the opening of "The Simpsons" on FOX-TV. And the income from those projects is very helpful in keeping my studio running - but it only gets me about halfway there if I want to keep creating my own animated shorts and features. Some advance theatrical distribution money from France also helps, but I've used Kickstarter to help fill the gap. My fans have helped with the production of two features, "Cheatin'" and "Revengeance", and a series of political shorts called "Trump Bites". My hardcore fans have bought their DVD or streaming copies in advance, which gets me the money early to finish animating the film faster, I don't have to wait for another big commercial project to come in and fund the feature.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Update on "Slide" production and "Demi's Panic" Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
Dear Kickstarter backers, 
It's been a while since I posted, and I apologize, but I've been crushed by a ton of work.
I'm still pushing hard, trying to finish the animation on "Slide".  I'm now about 3/4 of the way through the drawings - it's gonna be a big film, like a 2-hour epic maybe.  I'm working hard on this film, I want this to be my masterpiece.

updates.update_userinfo: Update on Slide rewards, plus Webby Awards and a new pandemic short
updates.update_content: Thanks once again to all the people who helped back my "Slide" campaign.  My office manager says that he's almost done sending out the physical rewards from the $50 level, which are the "Independently Animated" hardcover books.  He's just missing a few addresses, so if you're expecting a copy of that book and you still haven't received it, please make sure that we've got your current address!  The other rewards from the $50 level, which are the "Slide" DVDs for some $50 backers and the "Slide" streaming links for all $50 backers, will be sent out later after the film is complete.

Hello, backers!  Thank you all for your patience as we continue production on "Slide".  I've been very busy drawing, and my staff has also been very busy.  My office manager has started to send out some of the rewards, more on that in a bit.  

The animation for "Slide" is about 2/3 done.  And the music, from Maureen McElheron and Hank Bones, is about 1/2 done.  I think that if we continue at this pace, we may be able to finish the film around Christmas of 2021.  That's right, THIS YEAR.  Of course, there are a lot of variables involved and we're hoping that the funds raised by the Kickstarter campaign will see us through to the end.  But you never know, I may have to pause from time to time and take some smaller jobs here and there to raise some more.  Also, we're working on a new web-site for the film, and that should include a way for people to keep supporting the film, maybe getting similar rewards to those from the campaign!  We'll let you know when this process is complete and the new site is active.

I've been working on "Slide" since 2017 and it's been a slow process, for a number of reasons.  One is that I'm financing the film myself (with help from my fans through Kickstarter) and whenever I'm just about to go broke, I make a music video or take on some other job to pay my bills.  But also, I'm really putting my blood, sweat and heart into this film.  I believe this feature will be my epic.  I'm drawing everything that appears on the screen - the characters, the backgrounds, the vehicles, animals and even the special effects.

One more clarification - for the $350 reward level, the signed original art, the posted fulfillment date is now June 2022.  But that estimated date refers just to the streaming of the film "Slide".  We're planning to ship out the original art much earlier, as in January or February of 2021.  There's no reason to make backers wait for this art, when it can be shipped much sooner!  Thanks again for backing!  --JH

Dear Backers, 
The original art being offered at the $350 reward tier has been popular - so some of the drawings in our last rewards update have been claimed by backers at that level.  The following lettered drawings are no longer available, as of 5 pm on 12/16:  B, L, M, N, O, and Q.

Discover a place where robotics and bio-technology are accessible to many, where corrupt governments and crime organisations clash constantly in disputes over power.
PUNO is a 40 page, full colour comic, A5 size (14.8 x 21cm / 5.8 x 8.3 inch)
Take a peek at the first pages of PUNO. Welcome to the World of Peruvian Cyberpunk! 
(Page #3)
 (Page #4)
(Page #5)
 A nasty military manoeuvre is taking place in a small community on 'Altiplano', the Peruvian Highlands.
 Donovan, Minamoto and Vasquez are scheming their next move. (Page #11)
Lila, our main character, is reaching her limits and things are getting out of control. (Page #20)
 (Page #22)
 Why is Lila dressed like this, has she really lost control of things, what is really happening...? Well, PUNO will give you those answers and many more surprises.

PUNO is the 2nd volume of a 3 volume story. MANU, the 1st volume, was released in 2019 and PILCUYO, the last volume will be released by the end of 2021.

Now, why don't you get a taste of MANU? the first volume of Altiplano:
If Puno is your first entry into the world of Peruvian Cyberpunk, why not start at the beginning and get the PUNO + MANU Catch up?
The release of MANU last year was very well received and won the 2019 Best UK Independent Comic of the Year! (I still feel so happy and grateful for this!)
MANU is a 44 page, full-colour comic about monkeys, jaguars and cyborgs with a mystery. A5 size (14.8 x 21cm / 5.8 x 8.3 inch).
Take a look at some of its colourful pages: 
 Some words about MANU:
"Vargas’s use of colour is stunning but it’s his imaginative and inventive panel layouts that are sometimes highly structured, sometimes freeform depending on necessity, that really impress. This is an artist who has an instinctive understanding of how to use sequential storytelling to manipulate our perceptions of time, interaction, perspective and space."
 Andy Oliver, Broken Frontier
"In fact, what makes MANU a really strong read is that the character moments have as much impact as the action scenes, which gives everything much more depth and substance as a result."
 Alex Thomas, Pipedream Comics
"Manu is a triumph in cyber-punk done right. We have natural inclusivity, representation, gang warfare, and cyborg jaguars…c’mon, what more could you want? No wonder it was one of the hottest picks of last year."
 Parkersyashika, The Valkyries
The adventure doesn't stop here! All the Peruvian Cyberpunk Comics take place in the same universe. I have two more One-Shot Comics waiting for you: if you want to know a bit more about Lila's street-gang past, then pick up L1MA. Or maybe you are more intrigued by Xolo and his run-ins with the Shaman Mafia Lords in TRUJILLO.
L1MA is a 32 page, full-colour comic about pirañas, vultures, robots and mafias. A5 size (14.8 x 21cm / 5.8 x 8.3 inch). 
TRUJILLO is a 28 page, full-colour comic about gangsters, shamans, drugs & dogs. A5 size (14.8 x 21cm / 5.8 x 8.3 inch).  
 All of the digital books have English and Spanish editions. Drop me a line with your preference here on Kickstarter.  
 Phew. Okay. The first 4 Goals are unlocked! This means all physical backers will get: 2 Peruvian Cyberpunk Postcards, Cyberpunk Stickers Set, Cleonique's Vizcacha Cyborg Pin-Up and Elena's Bar Fight Pin-Up. Only remains to be unlocked PUNO behind the scenes, a character & Concept design Digital booklet, that will become available to all digital and physical Backers! 
What follows next:
The plot, script and character designs for PUNO are finished. The drawing stage is in process and will be finished by December 2020. You should receive your copy of PUNO by February 2021.
The Altiplano saga is my most ambitious project to date. Come and join me in this cyberpunk-madness! I have a feeling that you will enjoy reading it as much as I'm enjoying making it!
This is my love letter to Peru, in a very dystopian action packed way. Bienvenidos!

What is God-Puncher?
Issue 4 cover
Started 2 years ago by artist and writer, Lane Lloyd, God-Puncher is a high octane, off the wall Fantasy-Comedy about a man named Tim Finnly, the titular ”God-Puncher.” Betrayed by the gods he protected, Tim Finnly now hunts them down with his talking fists. 
Volume 1: Tim Finnly: Wanted!
This kickstarter is to fund a collection of the first five issues of God-Puncher. In this arc, Tim Finnly is being hunted by his arch nemesis, the lord of time, Syrem. Tim not only has to worry about Syrem, he now has to worry about an entire nation out for his head! He’ll need all the help he can get from a few strange characters if he hopes to make it out of this alive.
Where the comic started! (Issue 1)
Where the comic grew! (Issue 5)
Reading the first volume of God-Puncher is also getting to see the evolution of my writing and my art. So, if that gets you excited, perhaps you should back!
Who is God-Puncher for?
  Fans of comics like Hellboy and Head Lopper will love God-Puncher’s memorable characters and top tier world building. if you like your fantasy with frantic action, comedy, and more punches than a boxing match, God-Puncher is the comic for you!
What Are People Saying About God-Puncher?
In the two years that God-Puncher has been out in the world, we have gotten some tremendous praise for the series. here are a few choice quotes!
‘Wildly imaginative and highly stylized, God-Puncher feels like something you’d see on late night MTV back when that still meant unique, quality programming.” Matt Ligeti: Comic Boom Yeti  Read The Full Review Here! 
“The fast-paced nature makes each issue a fast read, yet enjoyable, making you want to go back and reread it for the amazing panel work.” Jason Jeffords Jr: Comic Book Yeti  Read the Full Review Here! 
“Overall, God Puncher’s a book that’s finding its footing as it goes but is working from an enjoyable foundation. I like watching series take shape, and with Lloyd’s imagination, aesthetic and zany sense of humor, there’s quite a lot here to enjoy as we go.” Christa Harader: Outright Geekery  Read the Full Review Here 
“The big scale world and big time issue that Lane tackles with God Puncher is perfectly juxtaposed by his art.” David: The Driving Creators Network  Read The Full Review Here! 
REWARDS! (What you’re all here for!)
Trying to keep this project simpe, but, i want to make sure you all get something for your generous funding! You’re making this dream possible, afterall!
For $10, you’ll get the PDF’s of the five issues that will be going into this trade as a way of saying thanks!
For $20, you’ll be getting the pdf’s as well as the trade, itself! 5 issues (and the rarely seen issue 0) will be in your hands to enjoy!
For $40, you get all previous rewards plus, an added poster!
And for $75, you get all previous rewards, plus, you’re book will be signed with your own pen commission on the inside of the book!
and AND! For 200, you get it ALL, plus, you get a single character, 8x10 commission! Lucky you!
Our Snazzy New Logo

campaign.story:
Hi, I am Joe Gillespie, a graphic designer & Illustrator working out of Philadelphia PA. You can usually find me on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook sharing work in progress and talking about movies, video games, and comic books.
 My Father Wrestles Alligators and Other Fantastic Lies From My Five Older Brothers is a children's book about all the crazy stories my older brothers told me as a little kid.
Book Cover Design
As the youngest of 6 boys I was often the recipient of many crazy stories. Stories about how my dad would wrestle alligators on the weekends. Or stories about how my grandmother was a quarter werewolf who didn’t like when you touched all the little trinkets in her living room. 
Was my grandmother part werewolf? Maybe...
These stories fueled my wild imagination and always had me wondering what was real and what was just another weird joke! While recently telling my son an “exaggerated story” about his grandmother, it dawned on me that I should collect all the nonsense my older brothers fed to me as a kid.
And the idea for My Father Wrestles Alligators was born!
When creating this book I really wanted to capture how I pictured things as a 6 year old. I believe the absurdity of it all shines through in my illustrations and hope you enjoy it!
Weirdos out of my head, onto the printed page...
The book is 100% set for print. I have written many drafts and worked with a few of my writer friends to button it up. I am pretty confident it is ready to share with the world. So if you are interested in an original story, looking for a one-of-a-kind gift, would like to help independent artists, I hope you consider backing My Father Wrestles Alligators and Other Fantastic Lies From My Five Older Brothers.
 My Father Wrestles Alligators will be beautifully printed in the greater Philadelphia area. The book will have a perfect-bound spine encased with a softcover. I plan on methodically reviewing the proofs and using a local printer will allow me to keep close tabs on the entire process. 
Along with the printed book you can receive some pretty cool rewards for helping get this project funded. Check out the mock ups below and please note that they could change in design but I will definitely share any revisions.

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone. Happy Friday!
I wanted to send an update on book shipping. As of today, only 11 books need to be sent out to backers of My Father Wrestles Alligators. If you haven't gotten your book yet, look for it very soon. 
Here is a rundown of what has shipped so far:

Hello All!
In case you don't follow me on Twitter, Instagram, or Facebook, printed versions of the book are hitting the post office later today! It is pretty exciting to get this book out of my hands and into yours. I hope you all enjoy it!

✅ Proofs Approved
✅ Bookmarks Arrived
✅ Stickers Arrived
✅ Shipping Boxes Arrived

Good Morning, hope you had a great weekend!
Production on My Father Wrestles Alligators moves forward with numerous updates this week. Let’s get right into each piece that I promised during the Kickstarter.
 Funding: I am still waiting on the verified funds from Kickstarter but think it will be in this week. I am moving ahead anticipating no hold-ups from them though.

The end of the Kickstarter is here and you all endured a month of me shouting from the rooftops about alligator wrestling, werewolf grandmoms, and hallway closet monsters. Maybe a few backers will trickle through over the next few hours and they are more than welcome to jump on the train as we head out of the station.
What is next?

Final Hours!!!
My Father Wrestles Alligators officially wraps on Kickstarter tomorrow at midnight! We are sitting at over 110% funding after an incredible month of support from my crowd. Thanks for making this little project such a success. If there is anyone you think might like this children’s book, there is still time to share the project and get in on the fun exclusives that will not be available anywhere outside this Kickstarter.

Being given to the circus might seem like a pretty good gig on the surface. You can watch the animals perform tricks, see the trapeze artists and cheer for the man getting shot out a cannon. But when you have 5 older brothers, some stuff gets whispered into your ear to twist the truth a bit. Couple that with the fact that Stephen King books and movies were the norm in my house, and you might have a kid not wanting to go live with creepily dancing clowns handing out red balloons. Beep beep Richie.

One of the best things about being an artist online is finding other creators to chat with, share tips, exchange art, and support their projects when possible. My online creative journey started with Twitter about 7 years ago. Before that time, other than art school, I never really had a group of creative minds to help out with projects.
Over the past few years, I have had some ideas start, stall, and stop. I plugged along, trying out new directions, following the progress of my peers online. All the while trying to figure out what was next for me.

campaign.story:
EEP was a bounty hunter for the Colony Planets, but she knew too much, so the government framed her! Now a "criminal" herself, she's been sent to Planet Y, the prison planet, where every evil man, woman, and mutant she ever put away is waiting for her on this... PLANET SLAMMER! 
Planet Slammer is an action packed sci-fi fantasy adventure! It is candy for your eyes and brain! Bright colors! Strange and grotesque creatures! Strong female protagonists! Weird underground and underwater worlds! People getting punched in the face and possibly decapitated! Dorky made-up names for made-up creatures and locations! If these things make you say, "I want this comic book!" Then let me tell you, friend... you definitely do want this comic book. 
PLANET SLAMMER #4
Planet Slammer #4 represents the end of the initial story arc for Planet Slammer. This campaign is raising funds to get #4 printed, but I wanted to make the whole story available to new-comers, so you will see that the rewards include options for you to get any issues you might be missing, or the whole series if needed! Issues are 22-24 pages long.
To make it super worth your while, there's also going to be a super-rad "making of" Planet Slammer Process PDF book included at every reward level. This book will include a look at the working script (like, literal scanned script with layout notes in the margins, etc.), thumbnail pages, and the final pencil roughs for just about every page of Planet Slammer #4. You will be able to compare the process against the final product, every step of the way. So far I'm at about 36 pages, but will probably add a few more to get into some finer details about the process. Really cool info for cartoonists, and people who are interested in that sort of thing in general. 
Finally, I'm also making available some original art for the higher reward levels. All of the original art levels will also include a printed copy of Planet Slammer #4 and all of the various digital rewards that come at the lower levels!

Well that is it, folks! The campaign has finished, and we funded at an amazing 239% of our goal! I can't believe it!! I am so thankful and appreciative to ALL of the backers, supporters, and everyone who helped get the word out about the Planet Slammer Kickstarter campaign. You all are the BEST! THANK YOU!!!!

Again -- thank you, and probably the next update will be when we finish this thing!

Hi everyone! The campaign seems to be chugging along. Thanks again to everyone, for your support both in backing and helping spread the word. 
I think I've just about got the Behind the Scenes Process Book wrapped up, and it's gonna be really cool! In case you forgot, it's a PDF book that is included at all reward levels, that details my process from scripted page to the final inks. It's basically turning out to be an "artist edition" version of Planet Slammer #4. I think you guys are gonna love it. Almost more excited about the process book than the book itself. So much goes into the finished book that no one sees, so it will be nice to share it with you all.

Well, this campaign has been live for one week now, and it's funded at 155% as I write this! I can't believe it, and I am so appreciative and thankful to all of the backers! It's already been an incredible ride. 
So, while the goal of this campaign was to get issue four printed, the ultimate goal for me has been to spread the word about my comics and get Planet Slammer into as many hands as possible. As much as I hate to sound like a commercial, I would be remiss if I didn't encourage you all to share, share, share! Spread the word about Planet Slammer and this campaign, and let's see how many people we can reach.

Welcome to the Generic Universal RolePlaying System!
With GURPS, you can be anyone you want – an elf hero fighting for the forces of good, a shadowy femme fatale on a deep-cover mission, a futuristic swashbuckler carving up foes with a force sword in his hand and a beautiful woman by his side . . . or literally anything else! Thanks to its flexibility, quality writing, and ease of use, GURPS has been the premiere universal roleplaying game for over three decades! 
More than 1,500,000 copies are in print – not counting foreign editions. GURPS Lite, a 32-page distillation of the basic GURPS rules, is available for free download. We also have dozens of GURPS adventures and e-books available on Warehouse 23.
Whatever your favorite roleplaying genre might be, GURPS can handle it. More about GURPS . . . 
The GURPS team, under the direction of GURPS Line Editor Sean Punch, has prepared a dozen different PDFs . . . and this is your chance to possibly grab all twelve of the new PDFs for only $3!
Starting with the latest expansion to the GURPS Action series (see Warehouse 23), your pledge of $3 secures you a PDF copy of GURPS Action 6 - Tricked Out Rides. This 10-page PDF, written by Sean Punch, is a quick-and-dirty toolkit for adventures where sports cars pack more gadgetry than fighter jets, and miniguns fit behind headlights!

One new PDF is great, but the project gets more exciting for all of the backers as stretch goals are unlocked. With each unlocked stretch goal (see below), we'll add another one of the twelve new PDFs to your rewards . . . that $3 pledge becomes an even better deal as more backers join the campaign.
Please share this campaign with all of your friends!
Are you looking for an even better deal? Check out the $99 reward! In addition to the new PDF and all unlocked stretch goals, you will also receive $125 in credit to spend in BackerKit on GURPS PDFs of your choice. See the add-ons section, below, for more information.
NOTE: Only PDFs published by Steve Jackson Games and currently listed for sale on Warehouse 23 will be available to project supporters. We cannot list PDFs by other publishers or PDFs that we do not currently sell.
Do you want even more PDFs? During the BackerKit survey (see below), we will offer these -- and many more! -- PDFs as add-on items. You may increase your pledge by the listed amounts and then, in BackerKit, make your exact PDF choices. All PDFs will be delivered through both BackerKit and Warehouse 23, our online store.
While we will not immediately offer every GURPS PDF that is available at Warehouse 23 in the BackerKit survey, we will do our best to meet your requests. If, once the surveys open, you do not see your preferred selections, please email help@sjgames.com for support and the team will add your choices to the survey.
NOTE: Only PDFs published by Steve Jackson Games and currently listed for sale on Warehouse 23 will be available to project supporters. We cannot list PDFs by other publishers or PDFs that we do not currently sell.
For those of you who cannot wait for this campaign to be complete to get your hands on more PDFs, you can find the entire catalog of GURPS PDFs at both Warehouse 23 and DrivethruRPG. Remember, though, that choosing add-ons during this Kickstarter campaign helps push us closer and closer to unlocking the stretch goals. The more funds we can raise during the project, the better our chances of unlocking all twelve PDFs!
Can we unlock all twelve PDFs before the clock runs out?
PDFs will be delivered through both BackerKit (see below) and our online store, Warehouse 23. We encourage you to create a Warehouse 23 account if you do not already have one so that your PDFs can be added to your Warehouse 23 library.
Learn more about Warehouse 23 here!
This project offers only PDFs. There will be no print rewards, and no print add-ons, so that we can concentrate on delivering the PDFs as fast as possible. This means no printed books, no dice, and nothing that would require shipping physical items. PDFs only!
BackerKit Surveys
We will be using BackerKit to collect email addresses and manage any add-on choices that you may make, and failure to complete your survey will mean that you will not be able to download your rewards. We will post an update when the BackerKit surveys have opened and, at that time, we will post the survey deadline date.
Once the Kickstarter campaign is over and all rewards have been delivered, the PDFs unlocked during this project will be released on Warehouse 23. At that time, each will be priced as individual titles; the special price of all unlocked PDFs for only $3 will only be available in this campaign.

updates.update_content:
On Monday, we're launching the GURPS Pyramid Scheme here on Kickstarter! Three new Pyramid issues -- one each for fantasy, modern, and future players and GMs -- every one of which expands in size as project stretch goals are unlocked. To better prepare you for the new campaign, we've now shared the article listings (both starting articles and stretch goal articles) for each issue:
Fantasy/Magic I article list

For those of you who have been asking about a second GURPS PDF Challenge, we're ready to announce that Steve Jackson Games' GURPS Pyramid Scheme is almost ready for Kickstarter launch. While not an exact copy of the approach used for the PDF Challenge that all of you supported earlier this year, the GURPS Pyramid Scheme campaign means more GURPS support for fantasy, modern, and sci-fi games.

Thank you, everyone, for your support of this campaign! As of earlier today, the last of the Warehouse 23 files have been distributed, shifting this project officially into the complete column. We could not have done this without all of you!
What's next for GURPS? Sean and the team are working on several new releases, and we have plans to take what we have learned from this PDF challenge and try something new in the future. Please follow the Warehouse 23 Kickstarter account for email notification when we launch a new project.

The Warehouse 23 fulfillment process has started! This will be done in stages and as quick as we can manage, but it will definitely take some time to get everyone's PDFs added to their Warehouse 23 accounts. Please hold off on contacting the team with project questions; we will post another update here once Warehouse 23 fulfillment is complete. 
How long will this take? Unknown. Darryll started the process earlier today and it is going to take weeks, possibly several weeks, to wrap up this stage of the project. We're still on track to complete the campaign by the estimated delivery date, and possibly sooner than that.

Thank you to everyone who has wrapped up your surveys! 
For those of you who have not yet completed your surveys, please remember that these must be finished by the end of August. At the end of the month, we will issue refunds for any incomplete surveys and you will be removed from this project. 
PDF Rewards

After a fairly smooth smoke test, we decided to open the doors so we can start the survey and delivery process. 
When will I get my PDFs?
PDF Purchases will be distributed periodically via Backerkit. After you complete your survey, it may take up to 7 days for you to receive download links in BackerKit.

Hey folks!
Moments ago I flipped the necessary switch to begin the Smoke Test for the GURPS 2020 PDF Challenge! Approximately 150 of you will be randomly selected across the various pledge levels to complete your surveys and collect your PDFs. We need your help to make sure that the whole BackerKit can roll out soon!

We've crossed the finish line with more than $57,000 in pledges. You didn't just unlock all 12 PDFs (remember when $45,000 seemed far off?) - you kept on going. Thank you for your support! 

More impressive is that when I say "you," I'm talking about more than 2,700 backers. That's . . . staggering. It's a big vote of confidence for short PDFs (at least some of the time!), future Kickstarters like this one, and GURPS. 

Again: Thank you. And thanks to Phil Reed for orchestrating everything, Steve Jackson for encouraging us to run with it, our writers, Steven Marsh for matching those writers with topics and art, and Nikki Vrtis for laying out a dozen PDFs in no time flat. It was a team effort in every sense!

- Sean "Dr. Kromm" Punch

campaign.story:
Two Swords Til Mercy is a spaghetti western set in a medieval realm created by Brentt Harshman, J. Paul Schiek, A.H.G., and LetterSquids that tells the story of one man’s quest to avenge his murdered brother and how this affects the entire realm of Mercy after the death of one of its prominent leaders. 
When the King of the Northlands is assassinated and a note reading “no more monarchs” is left on his corpse, his best friend, an elderly monk named Aldus Berryann, must travel across the realm to deliver the news to the Queen of the Southlands. However, unbeknownst to him, his guide and bodyguard, Lamond Yohe, is also on a journey to avenge his brother by hunting down and killing all the former cultists who took his life.  
Two Swords Til Mercy is a five-issue miniseries written by Brentt Harshman with line art by J. Paul Schiek, colors by A.H.G., and lettering by LetterSquids. Imagine if Sergio Leone directed an episode of Game of Thrones, and you'll come close to what we picture with this book. 
We are asking for $5,000 which will be split between production costs, kickstarter fees, printing, and shipping. 
WHO WILL ENJOY TWO SWORDS TIL MERCY?
- Fans of Tarantino, Sergio Leone, and Game of Thrones.
- Readers of Crone, East of West, and Once & Future.
- People who enjoy high octane action and engaging dialogue. Strong characters...oh, and bloody revenge. 
The point of this kickstarter is to raise funds to produce the first issue (of five) of a new comic book series. That's the main reward...but that doesn't mean there aren't other goodies outside of digital and physical copies of the books.
We will also be featuring original sketch cards, prints, pieces of art, other works by the creative team, short stories and watercolor sketches by EASTIN DEVERNA of SAMURAI GRANDPA fame, a custom printed map of Mercy, an alternate cover by J., variant covers by friends who also happen to be AMAZING artists, as well as stickers, shirts, buttons/pins, and coffee mugs as stretch goals if we surpass our goal of 5,000 dollars. 
Our first variant cover is an alternate cover by creators of the book J. Paul Schiek and Brentt Harshman!
Another variant cover comes to us from ANDY MICHAEL, friend of the team and artist on books such as sLAsher and Of Space!
 The third variant cover comes from SACHI EDIRIWEERA and colored by ELLIE WRIGHT. 
Our fourth variant cover is by Lane Lloyd (God Puncher)
and our final variant cover is by Emily Pearson (The Wilds, Bonding, SnapFlashHustle)
Mainly, we just want to make our book. I'm a firm believer that the product should sell itself, not gimmicks, so that is what we are showcasing. For $5, you get a digital copy of the book. For $15, you get a print copy of the book. While there are other goodies, the book is DAMN good and DAMN deserving of your investment.
I mean, who doesn't want to see a drunken mercenary stab a dude in the eye with a broken sword in the name of vengeance?
Cheers!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Comics are expensive to produce, so cost is the main hurdle we face. This book is the first of five chapters, each one costing around $5,000 to produce, print, and ship. While this is a daunting number, we believe it is doable and we believe we have a wonderful product that you will love.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

***READ BASED ON A TRUE STORY, A DUST BUNNY MAFIA MINI COMIC COLLECTION, FOR FREE BY CLICKING HERE. This is a great introduction into the Dust Bunny Mafia universe.***
***DOMESTIC US SHIPPING INCLUDED, and all books come signed by creator Bret Juliano.***
  Introducing, The Blind Tiger, a Dust Bunny Mafia comic collection.
What's contained in this 132 page collection?
The Blind Tiger contains over 200 comics, a pin-up gallery, Bret Juliano's guest strips for other webcomics, and a brand new book-exclusive comic chapter focusing on the Corvalus mafia family, entitled "As the Crow Flies."
Campaign Exclusives
Mobimal (mobster animal) drawn into the book
Crocheted Mobimal Characters
Limited edition poker chip
   Who will love Dust Bunny Mafia? 
Fans of mafia-related pop culture like The Godfather, Goodfellas, and The Sopranos.
Lovers of Saturday morning cartoons and the Sunday funny papers.
People who like cartoons such as Looney Tunes and Animaniacs.
Collectors of high quality independent comic books.
Here's What People are Saying...
 Based on a True Story
  You can read Based on a True Story, a Dust Bunny Mafia mini comic collection, for free by clicking here.
Bret Juliano - Creator
  Bret Juliano is a cartoonist and creator of the all ages Dust Bunny Mafia comic, which has over 650 comics in its archive and Mobimals. In late 2016, Bret published Meet the Family, a Dust Bunny Mafia comic collection. In 2019, he successfully funded a Kickstarter for Based on a True Story, a Dust Bunny Mafia mini comic collection. His dust bunny mobsters have also been included in several anthologies including Unlawful Good, Forgotten Histories and Out of the Deep as part of the Let’s Make Comics: Chicago Collective. He is an avid consumer of mafia trivia, both fact and fiction, and a passionate collector of fedoras.
For as far back as I can remember I was always drawing. When I was a kid, my dream job was to be an animator for Disney, but as I grew up, my focus shifted into the world of comics...newspaper styled comics especially.
Garfield, Calvin and Hobbes, Peanuts, Zits, Get Fuzzy...I could keep going, but I won't. I would read the Sunday funny paper back to back for years.
These were the things that brought joy to me and my comics, the Dust Bunny Mafia in particular, is my opportunity to tell my stories and give back in comics form.
I am coming to Kickstarter in order to create The Blind Tiger, a Dust Bunny Mafia comic collection because there's a supportive audience here that can help me grow my brand's reach and I know people need a to laugh and I know that my Dust Bunny Mafia comics can help with that.
Why did I write this book?
  I love mobster stories, they are the modern day version of the cowboys of the wild West.
 This book proposes a world where mobsters may not be evil. What if they are not the corrupt ones after all? What would it look like if the mobsters didn't know they were the villains at all?
What will the funds be used for?
With this Kickstarter, I'm looking to do a 200 copy first run of this collection. Last go-around, I was shooting for a 250 copy print run and was looking to cover all expenses of the project.
This time, I am only looking to cover the cost of the smaller print run, packing materials, getting the books delivered to me, and of course the Kickstarter & Stripe fees.
With a smaller campaign goal and less books, it should still allow for enough copies to fulfill the Kickstarter pre-orders and have some stock to sell at conventions in the future. 
Main Chapter: The Sugar Ban
When a nationwide sugar ban goes into effect leaving citizens craving  sugar, Leo Veronisci only sees opportunity. Allying himself with the  Corvalus brothers to leverage both families to push his bootleg sugar to  the masses makes both families rich. Until a bumbling detective  accidentally stumbles into a sugar delivery.
A Look Inside The Blind Tiger
So...What's in it For Me? (The Pledge Levels)
  Get Your Own Mobimal Drawn Into the Book!
At the Boss ($175) and Boss of Bosses ($300) pledge levels, I will draw your very own mobimal into the book in an advertisement for the Four Deuces casino, run by the Dust Bunny Mafia. Limited to 5 characters only.
Project Timeline
Milestone Bonus Gifts
  After we reach funding at each of the major milestones above, a new Blind Tiger related Dust Bunny Mafia mini-print will be revealed. Each print was done by a different comic artist, but I need your help to unlock them! Digital mini-prints will be sent to everyone at the Soldier level ($15) or above. Physical mini-prints will be sent with every Made Member level ($30) or above.
What's left to do?
The Blind Tiger is 99% complete.
There is only one page that hasn't been finished, the Four Deuces advertisement page. Once the Kickstarter ends, I will be in contact with the backers at the Boss and Boss of Bosses levels to get started on their mobimal characters, and hopefully be able to draw them in during the two weeks while I wait for the funds to clear.
Once that's been done, I can send the files to the printer and then ship the books out once they're printed.
Last year I brought my first project to Kickstarter, a mini comic collection, Based on a True Story and I can't thank everyone enough for supporting my work before on Kickstarter. You are directly responsible for helping me achieve this dream of producing my own comics. Please join me and back this Kickstarter to help my dream of making comics come true.
FREE PREVIEW
***READ BASED ON A TRUE STORY, A DUST BUNNY MAFIA MINI COMIC COLLECTION, FOR FREE BY CLICKING HERE. This is a great introduction into the Dust Bunny Mafia universe.***

In between launching the campaign again, I have re-worked several of the pledge levels and decreased the funding goal to reflect a lower quantity of books being ordered and taking on more of the cost for shipping the books out to you on myself.

As stated above, the collection is nearly complete. There is only one page that hasn't been finished, the Four Deuces advertisement page. Once the Kickstarter ends, I will be in contact with the backers at the Boss and Boss of Bosses levels to get started on their mobimal characters, and hopefully be able to draw them in during the two weeks while I wait for the funds to clear.

Once that's been done, I can send the files to the printer and then ship the books out once they're printed.

project_data.project_name: Dust Bunny Mafia: The Blind Tiger Comic Collection

campaign.story:
It all started with a couple of dust bunnies...
My name is Bret Juliano and I'm the creator of the Dust Bunny Mafia webcomic. Dust Bunny Mafia is Looney Tunes meets The Godfather. Seven years ago I first started publishing the Dust Bunny Mafia comic. Nearly 650 comics later, I am now coming to Kickstarter to help bring this mini collection to life.
What are people saying about the Dust Bunny Mafia?
Based on a True Story
Based on a True Story is a 24 page mini comic collection (8.5" X 5.5") containing 22 comics, printed in glorious full color, each based on a real life mobster stories. 
For years I have been fascinated with mobsters, but more memorable to me than Marlon Brando as Don Vito Corelone from The Godfather and Joe Pesci in Goodfellas, or any other Hollywood interpretation of the mafia lifestyle are the real life stories of the made members of the American mafia.
If you ask just about anyone to name a real life mobster, more often than not, the number one answer is going to be Al 'Scarface' Capone. Everyone can tell you something about Al Capone, but fewer can tell you much about his criminal mentor, Johnny "The Fox" Torrio, who after retiring from the head of the Chicago mob lived out the rest of his days peacefully, for another 32 years. 
Johnny "The Fox" Torrio doesn't get nearly enough credit as his protege, Al Capone.
When people think of Las Vegas, one of the first thoughts is usually the gambling, and people have a man named Benjamin "Bugsy" Siegel, to thank for that. With his Hollywood flair and charisma, he was crucial in developing the Las Vegas Strip as we know it today. 
Benjamin "Bugsy" Siegel was one of Las Vegas' most legendary visionaries.
These are the kinds of stories that fascinate me, and this collection is what I am asking for your help in bringing to print. 
What's left to do?
Based on a True Story is 100% complete.
Everything about this collection is done, all that's left is send the files to the printer and then ship the books out once they're printed. 
With this Kickstarter, I'm looking to do a 100 copy limited run of this collection. This should allow for enough copies to fulfill the Kickstarter pre-orders and allow me with copies to sell at conventions in the future. If the project is wildly successful and over-funded, I will look into printing more copies as the funding allows.
What Rewards Are Available?




Mobimals are a spin-off of the Dust Bunny Mafia brand where I took real life mobsters with animal nicknames and re-imagined them as their animal counterparts. The Mobimals: Chicago, first edition is a 12 page collection (5.5" X 8.5") featuring ten of Chicago's most fearsome animal nicknamed gangsters.
Several characters from the Mobimals: Chicago edition show up in the Based on a True Story comic collection which unites the Dust Bunny Mafia and Mobimals brands together to tell a unified story.
What about shipping?
Free shipping for the United States has already been pre-built into the pledge levels. For other countries, additional shipping costs will occur upon check-out.
As for the shipping materials, I will be using rigid photo mailers to ship out the booklets in. By using these materials I hope to minimize the amount of damaged products, but if anything does happen to your shipment, you can contact me and I'll fix it.
campaign.risks:

While this is my first attempt at Kickstarter, the collection is 100% complete and only needs to be printed and shipped. As soon as the project has been funded, the comics will be ordered. I've also put together an 8 page test copy of the artwork and everything is looking good from that end.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
GORILLA MY DREAMS is a black and white webcomic set in Struggle-Town, where the streets are protected by KNOCKAROUND-GUY, a talking gorilla who fancies himself a superhero. GORILLA MY DREAMS is best described as: BATMAN: THE ANIMATED SERIES mashed with TEENAGE MUTANT NINJA TURTLES if Saturday morning cartoons came on TV after 10pm. 
GORILLA MY DREAMS: GORILLA TAILS explores Struggle-Town and its residents, spotlighting not only KNOCKAROUND-GUY but some of the other characters who cross paths with him; The cops, the crooks, even wannabe superheroes. 
GORILLA TAILS is a 22 page comic book that collects 5 short stories from the webcomic. BUT the more money we raise, the bigger this comic book is going to get. That's right, EVERY SINGLE stretch goal in this campaign will bring more story and pin-up pages to this comic!
"It’s like a black and white Hellboy but with 300% more puns." Aaron Sullivan of COMIC CRUSADERS
"I thoroughly enjoyed this issue start to finish. Good jobs all the way around." - CBJ Episode #40
"Great lay-outs, exciting well composed action panels, and some really great character designs... Heaps of really cool ideas."- Radioactive Lounge Episode #97 
"It's the gorilla noir you never knew you needed in your life." Shane W Smith, creator of TRIMVIRATUS, UNDAD 
 READ MORE OF THE GORILLA MY DREAMS WEBCOMIC HERE!

 To learn more about the RETAIL PACK click HERE. 
To learn more about the T-SHIRT COLOURS & SIZES click HERE.  
CLICK HERE TO SEE PREVIOUS SKETCH COVERS BY BIG TIM! 
Learn more about adding GORILLA MY DREAMS: MIME OF MY LIFE to your order HERE!
Learn more about adding the GORILLA MY DREAMS: GORILLA TAILS T-Shirt to your order HERE!
Shipping from Australia can be BRUTALLY expensive for international backers. I'm a simple man, but I've done what I can to make things more affordable to people in the US and UK.
I'm really excited to announce that, in addition to our primary printer here in Australia (Jefferies), we've also got printers in the USA (KA-BLAM) and UK (CPUK) which means if you live in either of those countries, we can get your comics to you for just AU$8 postage, which is way better than trying to post from down under (AU$19+).
Unfortunately there's nothing I can do about the postage costs for T-Shirt levels ($50 & $100 tiers) or for backers outside the USA, UK or Australia. If those costs are too high for you, I'd recommend a digital reward tiers ($3 or $20). 
I have called in a few of my mates and have a lot of stretch goals lined up. If we exceed our funding, you can expect treats from the likes of Darren Close, Paul Gori, and more!

GORILLA MY DREAMS has been hatched from the egg-like craniums of Ahmed Rafaat and Big Tim Stiles, with the assistance of S. Greenleaf. The back cover/T-shirt art is done by Nathan Kelly.
AHMED RAAFAT (Co-Creator, Artist & Letterer): 
Ahmed Raafat is an Egyptian comic book artist currently living in the UK. He is the co-creator of EL OSBA (Arabic for: THE LEAGUE), an independent Egyptian superhero comic book series, and has worked on various comic book projects in and outside the UK.
Contacts:

  BIG TIM STILES (Co-Creator & Writer): 
Big Tim Stiles is an Australian writer, actor, and podcaster who has been working in the creative arts for over two decades. After four years of writing comic book reviews, he dove into writing his own comics, starting with his paranormal investigator/monster hunter CTHULHU WILLIAMS, before meeting his partner in crime Ahmed Raafat and co-creating GORILLA MY DREAMS.

His resume also includes Lettering & Editing for the following series: the apocalyptic horror series ESCAPE FROM JESUS ISLAND, the Fantasy/Western OATHBOUND, the grindhouse series, THE INFERNAL PACT/WHORE OF BABYLON, and the all-ages ghost hunter story FULL MOON FREDO.
To be quite honest, that’s just a few of the projects he works on. He’s a proverbial ‘glutton for creative punishment’ and just can’t say ‘No’ when a new, exciting project comes his way.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There is always the possibility of an unexpected Drop Bear attack or a stampede of hungry Bunyips, which could make delivery of GORILLA MY DREAMS: GORILLA TAILS troublesome. However, nothing short of that will derail my plans.

I've been a backer on Kickstarter for long enough to know that problems come up and delays happen. However GORILLA MY DREAMS is a project I want to see succeed and any future plans I have for the characters and comic book rely 100% on the backers being happy and wanting to come back for more.

GORILLA MY DREAMS: GORILLA TAILS and all this Kickstarter's Stretch Goals are 80% complete. Short of Ahmed losing his hands in an Evil Dead type possession (in which case, I would bring in another artist to finish the last few pages), there is no conceivable reason why GORILLA TAILS doesn't ship on time.

I can't promise to know every unexpected hurdle that comes my way, but I can promise to keep you in the loop every step of the way.
