campaign.story:
**FUNDED IN LESS THAN 24 HOURS!**
SKALD: Against the Black Priory is a classic, turn-based RPG. It's set in a dark and gritty fantasy universe: full of tragic heroes, violent deaths and eldritch, Lovecraftian horror. 
With a dark, immersive plot and inspired by legendary titles such as Ultima and the gold box series, this is my love letter to classic roleplaying.  
The project was an instant hit, reaching 100% funding within 24 hours! Now is the time to help make SKALD: Against the Black Priory reach its fullest potential as an epic tale of dark fantasy chock full of amazing 8-bit art and music! 

UPDATE: The game will now release for Windows AND Mac and backers may choose either version. The DEMO and BETA will only release on PC for now!


 SKALD: Against the Black Priory is a tile and turn based roleplaying game where you lead a party of up to six characters on an epic and perilous quest.
 SKALD ships with an optional, retro-style, CRT screen filter!


The game features: 
Vintage graphics using the glorious Commodore 64 color palette
Complex level-based character development with abilities, skills and features
Grindless tactical combat
"Choose-your-own-adventure" system and  dynamic, tree based dialog.
As a party based RPG, SKALD puts heavy emphasis on both roleplaying- and mechanical interaction between party members.

The current leader of the party can be swapped by the push of a button and the skills and abilities of the current leader will influence interactions with the game world. But be warned: Managing the party can be challenging with members having private agendas and motivations.
Combat in SKALD is turn- and menu-based. This leads to fast and grind-less combat (that can be automated). The design emphasis is on having interactions between abilities, tactics and situational circumstances create unique and challenging combat every time.
The game will feature a rich and highly interactive world with both scripted and systemic ways of interacting with the hundreds of NPCs, items, objects and plot points. The game will allow for, and encourage, a large range of player expression and roleplaying. 
Interacting with the world takes place through tree-based dialog, "choose-you-own-adventure sequences", combat, tile-based exploration and interaction with in-game systems. 
 SKALD: Against the Black Priory will feature level-based character development with both numerical stats and special abilities. I also intend for roleplaying choices to affect character development by taking a leaf from classics such as Fallout 1 and 2. 
SKALD is a fantasy setting and magic is a huge part of fantasy world building. It will play a big part in the game and designing a system that is both mechanically and narratively appealing is a challenge I can't wait to dig into! More on that down the line. 

The game will release on Windows and Mac first with releases for handheld devices down the line. NOTE: The demo and BETA version is for Windows only!
Estimated release date is June 2020. 

The Gallian Empire is in turmoil: By virtue of it's Wizard Lords, the Empire stood for a thousand years. Now the fabrics of the realm is fraying. Within, the ruling elite is losing its jealously guarded monopoly on the use of magics. Without, hordes of enemies threaten the realms of man.
In these troubled times heroes are few and far between. 
On the isolated island of Idra, lies the Black Priory. Its great libraries were once a haven of enlightenment and wisdom. These days its halls see far darker practices. The Wizard Lord dispatches an elite group of his finest knights to bring Imperial justice to the accursed monastery.  
However, all is nearly lost when disaster strikes on the high seas: The ship carrying the party is lost in a storm. All perish, save one: You.

Stranded on the shore of the bleak island, you are the people's last hope for Imperial justice!  
Gather what allies you can and prepare to face the Black Priory - pray your sanity holds!  


 The rewards for backing SKALD: Against the Black Priory span from digital copies of the game to awesome feelies and special rewards. 
The feelies for SKALD: Against the Black Priory are heavily influenced by games like Ultima 4 (shown above). For illustration purposes only!
The Game
Backers who recieve the game, get a DRM-free version of SKALD: Against the Black Priory for Windows or Mac shipped digitally and / or on a custom USB card. 

Demo and BETA
Backers who get the demo will recieve it shortly after the Kickstarter campaign ends. The demo represents the ALPHA version of the game and is intended as proof of concept. 
The closed BETA commences in late 2019. Backers who qualify will receive invitations as well as access to the "BETA tester" Discord channel. 
Game Map
The map will feature the games overland area. It will be hand-drawn and full color. Depending on tier. backers will receive it digitally, as a folded paper print or as a luxurious cloth map.  

Manual and Campaign Guide
The manual and campaign guide will, at a minimum, be a 32-page. soft-cover booklet with black and white illustrations. The manual will explain the rules and gameplay, whilst the campaign guide will serve as an introduction to the SKALD universe with an emphasis on the Gallian Empire and the Island of Idra with its locations and surroundings.
Besides providing hints and context for the main game, the campaign guide will contain enough information that it will be possible to use the setting in a tabletop RPG campaign.  
The manual will be available in print and / or as a digital file depending on reward tier.
Concept for the manual cover-art! Anyone get the D&D reference?
Design Rewards
At certain tiers, backers will be invited to participate in the design process for in-game content. Certain terms and conditions apply however: 
The backer must be able to participate before the deadline of May 2020
The creator retains full creative control and retains the right to refuse all and any content not suitable within the game and setting
The creator may alter any submitted content as he sees fit
The backer will be credited if any content is used

Exclusive In-Game Content
"The Hermitage" is a small Imperial safehouse in Idra where you will gain access to exclusive  items, recruitable NPCs and story content.
"The Lord of Idra" will give you access to a sea-side estate that will give you access to unique resources and characters. 
Both pieces of content may be released as add-ons to the original game down the line. 
T-Shirt
T-shirt sizes will be requested and must be provided within the deadline (approx. May 2020). Failure to provide a size before the deadline means we may not be able to guarantee the size of your choice. 

With the campaign blowing through the first 100% in less than 24 hours, it's now time to start thinking about stretch goals! We'll be publishing stretch-goals here as we go so stay posted! Goals so far:

100% within 24-hours: Full Color Cover *COMPLETED* 
We make the cover art for the manual full color!

90.000 NOK: Mountains of Madness  *COMPLETED*  
The adventure extends beyond the isle of Idra, into the icy hellscape that is the northern polar regions. Its hostile climate, cyclopean ruins and Lovecraftian horrors will test your mettle as you sail into the eternal night of the high north!

 105.000 NOK: The Captain class  *COMPLETED*  
The game is intended to ship with five "canonical" classes. If we reach 105.000 NOK I will design a sixth class:  "The Captain". The Captain is a combat based class with strong leadership skills and expert maritime and navigational skills.  

 120.000 NOK / 13.800 USD:  The Port of Adler’s Helm   *COMPLETED*  
Adler’s Helm is the northern-most Imperial provincial capital and the seat of Imperial power in the north. It’s also the jumping off point for the expedition to Idra and the Black Priory!
By adding Adler’s Helm to the game, I now get to make the game a three act piece: from the bleak isle of Idra, to the streets of Adler’s Helm and the frozen hellscape of the high North! 

140.000 NOK / 16.000 USD: Vile Volumes  *COMPLETED*  
If we make our fourth stretch goal, we get to be a lot more ambitious with the manual / campaign guide! We planned to ship with approx. the equivalent of 3 pages of illustrations. If we make the mark we'll up that to  the equivalent of 6 pages in a 32 page manual! 
This means we get to flesh out the city of Adler's Helm as well as add hand-drawn maps for locations and a fully illustrated bestiary of monsters! You'll be able to run a tabletop-RPG campaign in the SKALD universe! 
This also means we can afford to pay an editor to give the book the polish it deserves! 

160.000 NOK / 18.400 USD: Infinite Darkness   *COMPLETED*  
If we make our fifth goal, we're adding a procedurally generated murder-dungeon to the game as optional side content! The area will be completely optional and besides the main game, and will allow you to create a party of up to 6 custom characters and take them on a doomed descent into an infinite dungeon. This will allow you to keep enjoying SKALD long after you've finished the main game! 

180.00 NOK /  21.000 USD: To be revealed!
 Should we add:
A) Two more classes
B) Bounty-hunting
C) Crafting

I've been super lucky to have a group of extremely talented freelancers help bring the game to where it is today!
MementoMoree has been creating art since his late teenage years. Proficient in most types of art, from pencil & paper to highly detailed 4k textures, he's found solace and pleasure in the retro pixel art!

Twitter: @edwinmmusic | Web:  www.edwinmontgomeryaudio.com 

SKALD is being developed in the SKALD engine. This is a home made engine written specifically for creating old-school, tile based RPGs for modern platforms. The engine is built on top of Unity and has access to Unity's powerful cross compiler. 
The primary release for SKALD: Against the Black Priory is for Windows and Mac on Steam. Depending on how well the game is recieved I'll consider publishing on other desktop platforms as well as handheld devices.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With any project there is always a risk of the project failing to complete or severely under-performing. For SKALD the biggest risk stems from this being a solo-project. As a result, if something happens to me, there is nobody to fill my shoes and finish the project.

That being said, during the entire development process, I have adopted a stance of risk aversion. 

The game is developed on Unity 3D: A leading and well established game development tool. Unity 3D is well supported in terms of having a large community and a robust technical support system. There is also every reason to believe that Unity 3D will remain supported in the future. 

Furthermore, an advantage to developing a retro-style game is that mechanics and graphics are considerably easier to produce for small teams. I keep a very strict line on avoiding feature creep, and the graphical constraints limit bloating on the production of art assets.

The same can be said for backer rewards: the focus is on keeping the (physical) rewards limited and easy to handle. My goal is, first and foremost, to bring you the actual game!

Finally, development on SKALD: Against the Black Priory is already well under way and I maintain a playable build at all times. The demo of the game ALPHA version will be available July 2019 as a proof of concept.

Six years ago, SenshiStock and jademacalla got together for a fantastic photoshoot that resulted in loads of amazing action and dramatic pose references. 
We're DOING IT AGAIN! YAY!
Joining us for another amazing weekend of poses will be null-entity and PirateLotus-Stock! We will have two professional photographers, MANY exciting props, and tons of ideas for action, perspective, and drama. We will also be making composed group shots and doing casual interactions. 
The funds raised from the initial goal covers the domestic and international travel (~ $2300), lodging and food expenses for the trip for four people (~$1600), studio rental & fees (~$500) plus fees and taxes (~$1600). 
We have a few stretch goals when you help us exceed the initial goal!
Travel Locations For Models

At $7700, the images in the Backer Exclusives and Basic Set rewards double, plus we add Outtakes to the $25 level. We also unlock multi-camera shots of group poses AKA sets that show the same poses from more than one point of view.
If we keep going, we will start adding more models and make this epic event even MORE amazing! 
Pledge to this project now and help us get together for this most excellent pose reference collaboration!

Jade Macalla is a freelancer with an interesting wardrobe and a diverse skill set. One of those skills is acting goofy in front of a camera.
Erin is a pirate cat. She likes Type O- and Highland cows, and she hates loud noises and crumbs. Oh, and she does stock.
Kyle AKA Null-Entity is a Pro Rubber Duck Wrangler and avid METAL fan, He loves diving into stacks of mattresses for fun when not making aprons manly.
Blue usually takes pictures of dogs but these people are pretty wild so we think she'll do a great job.

Welcome! Out of the Deep is a comic anthology by Let’s Make Comics, a Chicago-based comic creator collective. Once a year for the last four years, we've pulled a theme out of a hat and then turned our members loose on it. This year the stories range from deep in the ocean to deep in space to deep in the mind, and the horrors (and beauty) you can find there.  
The book will be 52 pages, black and white and 8.5 x 11. The pages have all been turned in and the book is almost ready to go - we just need your help to get it printed. 
The goal of Let's Make Comics! as a group is, well, helping folks make comics. Books that don't go toward fulfillment are split evenly among participants - we're planning on 30 copies each this year - and leftover funds are put back into the group (convention fees, pizza parties, etc). Backing gets you a rad book and helps us us do a ton of cool stuff - If you're interested, take a look at the reward tiers below!

The books have been delivered! We finally have everything! A bunch of Let's Make Comics members are getting together on Saturday to fill envelopes and apply labels and eat pizza (after handling the books), so everything should go in the mail on Monday! 
Here are the obligatory boxes-o-books photos:
Hey, folks! The buttons and prints are here, and I've gotten the proof! of the anthology! Take a peek!

Hi, folks! You should have all just gotten links to the PDF of Out of the Deep. Let me know if you run into trouble downloading it - we did some test runs, but there's always the chance something will go wonky.
Also! Stuff has started to arrive from the printers! We've got the buttons and the prints should be delivered tomorrow. I'll post another update with photos as soon as we have them.

Hello, folks! This is a quick update to let you know the money hit our account. I've started sending stuff to the various printers and we hope to start shipping by the end of April. More information - and photos - as we get it!
(I just realized I posted two Update 3s, whoops.)

We did it! The Out of the Deep anthology is our most successful kickstarter yet and it's all thanks to you folks. Thank you! 
It'll take about two weeks for the funds to hit our account. We'll spend the time doing final prep on the book, so it should be ready soon afterwards. I'll let all y'all know once the money drops, and again when the books go to the printers. Keep an eye on your inboxes!

BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY needs your help to print our new book, THE SCOURGE OF THE MECHANICAL MEN (A Granville Woods and Nikola Tesla story). It is a 34 page story in a 44 page perfect bound book, which means 10 pages of extras!
If you are new to the series, the original six issue mini-series is about an ex-Pinkerton detective, a spirit photographer, and a genius scientist who battle supernatural forces in late 1800’s Boston. They live in an alternate steampunk history where ghosts and demons are a normal part of life. Families known as the Great Houses control the economy of the Great States of America while the middle class and lower classes sole purpose are to serve the Great Houses.
THE SCOURGE OF THE MECHANICAL MEN is a standalone continuation of the series written by Madeleine Holly-Rosing. Art, inking, and color are by Gwynn Tavares.
THE STORY
Granville and Tesla are in a race for time to save Boston from a mysterious disease that turns human beings into machines.
Granville returns home to Liberty Row only to find an almost insane Tesla hiding there. But his efforts to get rid of Tesla hit a snag when they discover that a virus is turning humans into soulless mechanical men. Realizing that Emily and Travis Morgan of Morgan Medicinals are behind the outbreak, they fear that the twins are after more than just control of Boston – They want to take over the Great States of America.
EMILY AND TRAVIS MORGAN
Emily, a brilliant scientist, has spent her life creating cures for other people and seeing none of the financial rewards or acknowledgement. Her brother Travis handles the business side of the company and resents that neither he nor his sister has ever been given their due.
Can Granville and Tesla work together to save the city? Or will Boston and the Great States of America fall under the control of THE SCOURGE OF THE MECHANICAL MEN?
Cover art, inking, and color by Gwynn Tavares.
The entire story is off to our letterer, Troy Peteri, so here are the first three colored pages for you to see the amazing job that Gwynn has done.
      NEW TO BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY?
No worries. The original trade paperback is available in several reward tiers.
 Cover art by Emily Hu. Color and inking by Gloria Caeli.
WHAT'S IN THE TRADE?
I'm glad you asked. Not only does it include all six issues from the mini-series as well as the cover art, but it also contains a Boston Metaphysical Society ten page short story called, Hunter-Killer, and additional bonus pages. With art by Emily Hu and coloring by Gloria Caeli, the story is set at the beginning of the House Wars (my version of the Civil War) and features the crew of a prototype airship. I introduce three new characters: Gwen Warrick - Captain; Emmet Rochester - Navigator; and Joaquin Medina - Engineer.
And for what the story is about, well I have two words for you - Airship Battle!
The complete story of Hunter-Killer will ONLY be available in the trade.
THE MONEY:
Where the money goes...Your backing would enable us to pay for a print run of the book which means printing enough copies to send off to backers with some leftover to sell at conventions, incentives, shipping (which includes mailing envelopes, postage and handling.) And, of course, the fees (5% off the top, plus credit card fees.)
THE TEAM FOR THE SCOURGE OF THE MECHANICAL MEN:
Madeleine Holly-Rosing - Writer/Creator: A TV, feature film, and comic book writer, Madeleine holds an MFA in Screenwriting from UCLA where she won numerous awards as well as the Sloan Fellowship. Madeleine has published a number of short stories and novellas based on the BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY universe. She is currently writing the four issue mini-series, Kasai: The Homecoming, for Evoluzione Publishing/SFC Comics. She also has upcoming sequential art short stories in: The 4th Monkey Anthology, The Edgar Allan Poe Project, The Eynes Anthology, The Rum Row Anthology, and the Cthulhu is Hard to Spell, Ain’t It Anthology. 
Gwynn Tavares – Artist/Colorist: Gwynn starter out her art career as a sculptor. After a few years working on movie special effects, she decided to go into sequential art and was the artist for Amelia Sky. Majoring as in illustrator, Gwynn is also an accomplished comedian and lives on a sailboat in San Francisco Bay.
Troy Peteri – Letterer: Troy is a Los Angeles based letterer whose credits include AMAZING SPIDER-MAN, IRON MAN, and roughly 98% of all the comics from Top Cow Productions for the last 6+ years. He also co-wrote and lettered ABATTOIR, a mini-series for Radical Comics.
THE TEAM FOR BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY TRADE PAPERBACK:
Madeleine Holly-Rosing, Writer/Creator. (See credits above.)
Emily Hu – Artist: Emily is a graduate from the School of Visual Arts in New York City. She has been drawing ever since she was little and it's been her lifelong dream to make it as a comic book artist. Her main influences are Eduardo Risso, Becky Cloonan, and Ito Junji. She works freelance and has created covers for BOOM! BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is her first comic book series. Emily is currently doing storyboards for Marvel.
Gloria Caeli – Colorist: Based in Jakarta, she has worked for Avicom Advertising and Stellar Labs. Her most recent projects are BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY and VOODOO. She like anyone else enjoys music, photography, travelling, and reads a lot of genre related books.
Fahriza Kamaputra – Colorist: Based in Jakarta, Fahriza is a self-taught comics and concept artist. He worked as a colorist on VIENETTA AND THE STUPID ALIENS which led to his work on he webcomic ROKKI with Stellar Labs. His current work includes Bob Salley's, Salvagers and Shelter Division.
Shawn Aldridge (Letterer – Chapter 4) Shawn Aldridge is a Portland based writer and letterer. He’s best known for his awarding winning creator-owned sci-pulp series, VIC BOONE. He also writes and co-created GoGetters from MonkeyBrain with artist Christopher Peterson. His work has also appeared in FUBAR, the NYT bestselling anthology series.
Troy Peteri – Letterer (Chapters 1-3, 5 and 6) (See credits above.)
WHAT OTHER PEOPLE SAY
"Women and people of color take center stage in the Boston Metaphysical Society comic, written by Madeline Holly-Rosing, with art by Emily Hu. Inspired by fantasy and the art of storytelling, Holly-Rosing uses her imagination to create a fantastic story that is both well-written and fearless." - Valerie Complex (Fansided)
"If you have a taste for an intelligent, well written, elegantly illustrated award winning independent book, you can't go wrong with Boston Metaphysical Society!" - Alex Yarde (The Good Man Project)
"This very inventive series posits a totally believable Steampunk world that is populated by appealing characters who act (and react) in believable manners to the extraordinary events that swirl around them." - Robert Sodaro (Comic Reviewer at Examiner.com)
The original series was also nominated for Best Comic/Graphic Novel at the 2014 Geekie Awards.
THE STORY BEHIND THE STORY
For those of you who have read the original series, my version of Tesla is not what you usually see in fiction, but it does stay true to his obsessive nature. Granville was a real person and a contemporary of Thomas Edison and Alexander Graham Bell. (He did business with both of them.) As a writer, I wanted to put my fictional versions of Granville and Tesla in the same room together for an extended period of time to see what would happen. Let’s just say that Granville is more of a hard ass than I thought he was. This story allowed me to delve deeper into the lives of those who did not belong to a Great House, but were closer to the rest of us. Specifically, I wanted to show what it was like to live in Liberty Row, the middle class Negro neighborhood I created for this universe, and those whose work was used by the Great Houses, but never received any benefit for their effort.
I love writing BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY. Not only does it bring my love of science fiction and history together, (which by the way, equals steampunk), the steampunk time period allows me to address the themes of classism, sexism, and racism in America in a thoughtful and entertaining way. For at its very core, BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is an American story. And you can't tell an American story without including women and people of color.
It has been and always will be important to me to write characters who, though they come from diverse backgrounds and have different points of view, are able to work together for the common good.
INCENTIVES
In addition to THE SCOURGE OF THE MECHANICAL MEN, we are offering the trade paperback which includes a brand new ten page story, a BRAND NEW bookmark, the anthologies, Boston Metaphysical Society: Prelude and Some Time Later, and a NEW BMS TRIQUETRA LAPEL PIN. It is 1 inch in diameter and will be an antique copper color. (See image below.)
(Pin designed by Bill Meahan.)
Lapel Pin Set
A set of all four Boston Metaphysical pins (Dirigible, Tesla, 1800's Box Camera, and Triquetra) in a lovely gift box with our logo are available as well.
SPECIAL COMMISSION REWARD TIER
Did you ever want to meet Granville Woods or Tesla? Well this may be the closest you'll come as Gwynn and I are offering this limited (6) reward tier where you will be drawn next to Granville and Tesla (in appropriate period costume) in an 11x17 print. Here is the portrait in which a chosen few will be drawn into:
The print will be on 80 lb. Classic Stipple to give it some heft.
And if you haven't read Boston Metaphysical Society: Prelude yet, then this would be the perfect time to get it. This anthology of short stories and novellas includes stories of how Granville and Samuel met and their first case together; what set Caitlin on her path; and how Samuel met his wife, Elizabeth Weldsmore Hunter. Several reward tiers include it as either a pdf or print version.
The latest Boston Metaphysical Society short story, Here Abide Monsters, was published in the anthology, Some Time Later, in May 2017 from Thinking Ink Press and is available in a number of reward tiers. The anthology also includes stories from Harry Turtledove and a number of other notable authors.

 A bit about Karl:
Karl’s passion as a storyteller began when he received his first job drawing comic books professionally while still in High School. He quickly climbed his way up to an assistant position contributing artistic support and story concepts on Marvel's X-Men, Uncanny X-Men and X-Factor. He soon became an artist/writer for Marvel, DC and Image comics on such titles as X-Men, Avengers, Silver Surfer, The Hulk, Superman, Bloodstrike, and Battlestar Galactica.
Always looking for new challenges, Karl created his own comic book publishing company Hyperwerks Entertainment. While managing Hyperwerks, he co-created and published several hit titles including Saint Angel, Cats Eye and the hugely popular flagship title Deity.
After eight successful years in publishing, Karl entered the toy industry working with MGA Entertainment Inc.,Razor USA, Jada Toys, Playmates and Spin Master, Mattel and Lootcrate as a toy designer.

Over the last few years, I’ve run across a number of comics, both online and at Cons, I’ve enjoyed. I decided to curate a few especially for this Kickstarter from creators you may or may not be familiar with, but who have unique stories to tell.
This stretch goal is available to anyone who has pledged $6 or more. That means six more digital comics to add to your collection!
So, without further ado, let me introduce you to…
Katrina Hates the Dead by Russell Nohelty.
What would you do during the Apocalypse? How would you survive? Those are the questions that have plagued Katrina for years. All the good boys and girls were raptured up to Heaven, leaving the rest of humanity to ask a single, solitary question: “Why not me?”
Russell is the owner of Wannabee Press, The Complete Creative and has not only written graphic novels and novels, but has the best business book out there for creators called, Sell Your Soul: How To Build a Creative Career. http://www.wannabepress.com/about/
Gods of the Game by Jody Susskind
A group of friends who love to play RPGs find themselves in the world they created. A throwback to the 80’s, Gods of the Game is a mix of fantasy and D&D. http://godsofthegame.com/
Demon Hunter Kain by Gil Burrell
Mysterious disappearances… grisly, ritualistic murders… terrible things lurking in the shadows… All these can be found in New Babylon… the most haunted city in the world. Kain Smith’s plan was simple: Acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to become a Demon Hunter thereby continuing his clan’s ancient heritage and giving himself a chance to make amends for a horrendous event from his past. Things begin to get complicated when he meets and befriends Zandalee Joseph, a mentally unstable(?) girl with strange powers. Now… between being a teenager, befriending Zandalee, high school, ruthless Demon Hunting mentors, living in the most haunted city in the world AND whispers of the coming Apocalypse, will Kain survive long enough to achieve his goals? http://www.demonhunterkain.com/
Retro Blade by Freya Horn
In the year 3007 a reality crash has wiped everything out, and the last known survivor Axel Kepler is working his way backwards through time, trying to figure out where it all went wrong. With a severely out of touch Database, a Transmutation Device for food (that, if anything, makes molecules less edible than they were before) and only a cryptic Blueprint left by his sister to guide him, he needs help…He needs a Team. Together, they will find out how to fix things, who the good guys really are… and why people from the future have such cheesy haircuts. ‘Meanwhile’, a few millennia earlier… a young boy named Magnus is bestowed with remarkable powers he was never meant to have, and chooses not to save the world with them. http://retrobladecomic.com
America’s Kingdom by Brian Hawkins
America’s Kingdom is about a modern-day alternate history America under the rule and reign of one family – the descendants of George Washington, known now as King George I, after the end of the American Revolution in 1776. The series begins shortly after the demise of the latest sovereign, King George X, when his son, Prince Geoffrey, is poised to take the throne.
Soul’s Journey by Sophie Pfrötzschner
Anrak, crown-prince of the Kingdom of Antorea, finds himself trapped in a wolf's body after running away from home. Meanwhile his country is at the verge of war with two neighbouring states. Now Anrak has to figure out the nature of his current condition and find a way to reverse it in order to regain his actual body to prevent a conflict he so carelessly set in motion. Sophie is a Germany-based artist, writing and drawing the comic in her spare time.
When not napping on her couch she enjoys reading comics, lazing around Netflix and procrastinating on social media.http://soulsjourney.gerritianchronicles.com/

I have more awesomeness for you. Check out these six amazing indie creators. Anyone who has pledged $6 or more will receive this digital bundle. That's six more comics to add to your digital collection!
 Let me introduce you to...
MAIDEN OF THE MACHINE BY CAITLIN LIKE
A cartoonist based out of Portland, Oregon and Caitlin likes to make comics with fancy dresses, egregious floral motifs, occasional horror, and even more occasional face-punching.
The story: Maiden of the Machine is about a young woman named Elizabeth Watson who finds herself being the protagonist of a completely wrong kind of story. Too traditional to take part of her adventurer family lineage and too poor and obscure to be a true society lady, Elizabeth’s fortunes change with the introduction of famed industrialist Mr. Victor Lovelace in her life. She is soon pulled into his world of industry and conspiracy- where violence is the norm, sky pirates roam the skies and a woman with wings made of brass and steel hunts in the night. https://www.patreon.com/CaitlinLike
WRETCHES BY JAMES ROCHE
At the end of the day I just want to create some stuff and be able to look at the finished product and be proud. The idea of creating something totally new, that wasn’t here before, and to have it in front of me for the rest of my life, is why I do this. Here's a little "resume": • Been writing comics since about 2010. • Have had some shorts published. • Created the science fiction/fantasy series, Wretches, which has had its first two issues successfully funded on Kickstarter. • Co-Created The 4th Monkey: An Anthology for Awareness, which had it's first book successfully funded on Kickstarter. http://www.jameseroche.com/
The Story: This is a story about family. About loss. All Shea & Sean have is each other. Until they don't even have that.
SHAMAN’S DESTINY BY KYRUN SILVA
Writer, Artist and Creator of Shaman's Destiny. Writer and creator of Xob the Lightning Wielder
Kyrun's earliest memories are of drawing characters in his room while watching cartoons on TV. As a young boy, Kyrun couldn't stop drawing and creating. He was fascinated with everything from cartoons, sci-fi, fantasy and other geeky things, but comic books was and still is his main addiction. From the storytelling to the beautiful artwork, he knew he had to be a part of this world.
Kyrun launched Taurus Comics in 2018 with the slogan "less bull, more comics" His goal is to produce high quality books that will entertain and titillate the mind.
THE STORY: Follow the adventures of Malik as he is chosen by the spirit of the earth, Gaea, to protect our world. Our world is being overrun by threats from other planes and realms. It's Malik's job to help save us from these threats. Malik will be confronted by perils from all sides and with the help of his mentor, Jeph, he will have to decide who to give his trust to.
MY HERO BY JIM PERRY AND ALLI MYRES-PERRY
My hero! is a webcomic written by Jim Perry and illustrated by Allison Myres-Perry.
The story follows the adventures of a Guardian named Hasera who cannot perform even the most rudimentary requirement of her job: Healing. Hasera has been reading Harlequin romance stories since she joined The Order of the greatest Champion who ever lived across the 9 planes: Lark. One day she wishes to meet the great and chivalrous hero of her dreams. Remember two important sayings: “Be careful what you wish for.” and “Never meet your idols” http://www.myherocomic.com/
VANGUARD BY DAN BUTCHER (Adult)
Can and I have known each other since I first ventured on to Twitter. He was also kind enough to create fan art for the comic in the early years. He started, as do a lot of comic artist, by drawing and creating characters and comic strips at an early age. Studying art through school and ended up earning a degree in Illustration and Design. After a short career as an animator (where he realized drawing the same image over 200 times wasn’t for him), he defected to the ‘Dark Side’ and began working as a graphic designer, which he now does as his ‘proper’ job. He hails from the U.K. His work-to-date includes: The Awesome Comic – With Vince Hunt and Tony Esmond; El Marvo – with Luke Kondor & Ben Errington; Papercuts and Inkstains – Various; Assault of Fortress Doom – Lex McDonaldComichaus – Suited & Booted with Jon Laight
The story: Created, written, and illustrated by Dan Butcher, Vanguard focuses on an eponymous team of British superheroes, led by South London orphan Paul Drake AKA Pendragon.
http://vanguardcomic.com/
DELILAH BLAST BY MARCEL DUPREE
The editor-in-chief of Evoluzione Publishing and SFC Comics, I met Marcel while we were both running Kickstarters. I fell in love with Delilah Blast, a scifi steampunk version of Girl Genius. He has a number of other titles either out or in production including, Kasai: The Homecoming, which he brought me on board to write. Be sure to check out all the Evoluzione/SFC titles, including Angelica Reigns, Sword Theory, Villain, and more.
The story: Science runs the world and the Earth is governed by the E.S.A., the Earth's Science Association. Everyone is allow to join the organization on their sixteenth birthday, but unfortunately for Delilah Blast she oversleeps, missing the entrance exams and putting her dream in jeopardy. However, when another opportunity to achieve her dream presents itself, Delilah is more than willing and ready to take it, even if it means going to a dangerous alien planet to retrieve obscure technology that could change the world and Earth forever. https://www.facebook.com/evoluzionepublishing/

 STRETCH GOAL #6 - $9,500

Check out these six amazing indie creators. Anyone who has pledged $6 or more will receive this digital bundle. That's six more comics to add to your digital collection!
 Let me introduce you to...
DON WALKER
REAPER CORPS #0 'What if Cameron's Terminator and The Matrix had a love child?' Enter a world where sentient Cyborgs pray to a God. Clones fight for civil rights. And Mankind is an endangered species.
The Story: 2308. Earth. After a surviving a devastating galactic war with the alien Zartori, what's left of mankind's society has returned to Earth to rebuild.. With a human population under three hundred million, man must rely on the aid of a warrior class of sentient cyborgs for protection against a now subservient class of Cloned humans who seek a place in this new world order. In the midst of all this are a growing number of Cyborgs who believe mankind isn't worth the trouble.
Full color. Sci-fi action adventure. One shot. (W/P) DON WALKER (I) JEFF GRAHAM (C) NICOLAS CHAPUIS (L) ED DUKESHIRE AGENT WILD #0
AGENT WILD is a Hunter Agent (assassin) for the alien para military police unit known as 12TH HOUR. These agents are tasked with policing the secret alien presence on Earth. While on suspension for a failed mission that saw her partner killed, Agent Wild is re-activated and sent on a routine mission that turns out to be anything but routine. When a 'ghost' from her past returns with plans to start a galactic civil war. Agent Wild has to make a choice. Kill him, or help him overthrow the alien alliance they both serve, lead by Agent Wild's Mother. Full color. Sci-fi action adventure. One shot.
'Wonder Woman in a power suit.'
(W/P) Don Walker (I) Larry Welch with Jeff Graham (C) Nicolas Chapuis with Jesse Heagy (L) Ed Dukeshire
ANDY PURVIANCE
I, MUMMY
The Story: A steampunk mummy in a dress from the 22nd century, Jane is an impulsive teenager turned mummy who investigates her own murder with the assistance of a cantankerous ghost. Our story occurs in a future based on predictions from the late 1800s—a future where everyone can fly and there’s no such thing as wi-fi.
SUSAN LEE
WRAITH OF LOVE, VOL. 1
The Story: After a battering at the hands of her abusive boyfriend, Jameson Mercer's failed suicide attempt imbues her with unique powers and she becomes a vigilante for those who have become victims of destructive relationships.
MARCUS KWAME ANDERSON (ARTIST); LEONARDO FAIERMAN (WRITER)
SNOWDAZE
The Story: Snow Daze is a comic book created by writer, Leonardo Faierman and artist, Marcus Kwame Anderson. Loosely based on Leo’s experiences shoveling snow as a teen in Queens NY, the story concerns enterprising teens of color in a strange suburban land, navigating the bridge.
JAMES KERSEY
THE AMOK BROS.
The Story: Useless Future is an anthology comic featuring the work of Jim Kersey. This issue features a possible origin story for The Amok Bros. escaping from an unlicensed robot factory, as well as the introduction of the mysterious Neutro Gina.

campaign.story:
BUILT FROM HUMAN PARTS is an anthology magazine that explores various aspects of humanity through the lens of the modern or near modern world - stories firmly grounded in reality even if that particular reality is one that is still up and coming. VOLUME ONE features tales of people struggling to find their purpose in the present, people dealing with the consequences of their pasts, and people preparing for an unexpected future. The stories vary wildly from very down to earth and grounded stories to very bizarre science fiction tales. 
  mockup
 The first issue features 2 comics, 4 prose stories with illustrations, and 1 audio drama narration. One of my goals is to get the resources to record two more dramatic recordings of stories.
On Going List of Project Updates
Story Spotlights
Afterimage by Steve Ormosi with art by Edwin den Ouden
Jumpcut Memory by Paul Grimsley with art by Katherine Nurmi
The Flick of the Wyvern's Tale by Steve Toase with art by William Cunningham and narrated by Natalie Culbreth
Mister Nickname by William A. Couper with art by Seb Fowler
Regret by K. Patrick Glover with art by Dextra Hoffman
Behind the Scenes
Recording Wyvern's Tale
Rewards
Built From Human Parts: Purpose & Consequence
Exclusive T-Shirts
T-Shirts and Poster Options and Additional Shirts/Posters Discounted
Digital Contributor Bundle
Hand Painted Coffee Mug or Plate
Appreciation
One Third Funded and Update Schedule
Halfway Mark and General Updates
75% Funded, Only 6 Days Left!
104% Funded, 50 Backers, 52 Hours To Go
THE STORIES
BUILT FROM HUMAN PARTS: PURPOSE & CONSEQUENCE is a print collection of 6 stories, each with a writer and artist, and a single narrator dramatic reading of one of the included stories.  
"Denying Passage"
Cameron Callahan/Dylan Canfield
Bits of a news broadcast shown between the other stories where husband/wife team relay exclusive information they have received from a source (Their field reporter son) regarding a string of murders.
"Mr. Nickname"
William A. Couper/Seb Fowler
A journalist who secretly works under multiple pseudonyms lands an interview with a successful business man with a tangled past.
"Regret"
K. Patrick Glover/Dextra Hoffman
A spy novelist visits his childhood home town after an unfortunate atrocity occurs.
"The Flick of the Wyvern's Tale"
Steve Toase/William Cunningham
A prominent art Collector returns to his home after an evening out to discover his home has been Invaded and a special portion of his collection disturbed. Dramatic reading of this story, performed by Natalie Culbreth, will also be made freely available.
"Jumpcut Memory"
Paul Grimsley/Katherine Nurmi
A scratch-head's perception of the world fragments and alters as a he becomes aware of the reality of his life and purpose.
"Afterimage"
Steve Ormosi/Edwin den Ouden
A moment of exploration into the value of what is "real"  and the areas of technology that allow us to mold what that means.
For the duration of the campaign I will be posting an update each Monday and Friday focusing on one of the stories - telling you about the creators, their story, and giving prose and artwork previews. On Wednesdays I will post an update related to some of the other aspects of the project, as well as share with you the full text and dramatic reading of one of the stories along with my experience creating something like that.
Voice actress Natalie Culbreth and recording engineer Daniel Treharne
WHO I AM
I'm Cameron Callahan. I grew up watching cartoons and reading comic books. In December 2008 I found myself unemployed and decided to devote all of my free time to making silly comic books that featured robots and lizard creatures. Early 2009 saw me moving out to the desert at the request of my mother, to help with some family issues. During this bizarre, isolated time in the desert I finished a 32 page comic book of short stories starring Primus, a naive but well meaning robot with lizard creatures for parents. Over the next few years I wrote and doodled two other print issues that have somehow been purchased from people all over the world. I also have had short comics printed in zines/anthologies put together by others. In 2016 I successfully Kickstarted a paperback collection of the first three Scrambled Circuits minicomics, featuring commentary to go along with the stories.

Just a few months after I decided I wanted to doodle, my comics were briefly talked about on the (now defunct) ART & STORY podcast (Listen Here). I had a short comic in an issue of the zine anthology Candy or Medicine that was reviewed on The Comics Journal website where I was called an "artist to watch" (Read Here) by reviewer Rob Clough. Rob would later do a more in depth review of the first four Scrambled Circuits issues on his own site (Read Here).
WHAT I'M MAKING
For many years I have wanted to explore the anthology format. Through different mediums I have always enjoyed this format for it's flexibility in story telling. Whether on television, old time radio plays from the 50s, or the many printed prose and comic anthology series, I have just always been enchanted by them and slowly over time I found myself building a vision of what I wanted to do in the format. Then in October of 2016 I went to a group of creative people I have known for years and I rambled to them about what I wanted to make.
It was about an hour after being hired for a seasonal position that I went to this group. I have a full time job that (barely!) covers bills and the general cost of living. This second job was sought out for the sole purpose of ensuring I could handle all of the expenses a project like this would cost. A project that involves over a dozen contributors, scattered geographically all over the planet, as well as also some audio drama recording as well. These expenses are things like software/services, artist payments for art/stories/voice acting, renting a room for recording, dialog editing/sound engineering, etc. 
When that seasonal job ended I got a permanent second job to pay for this project. And now it is done. This first one is, at least.

campaign.story:
Hello and welcome! My name is Dwight MacPherson and I'm the creator and writer of The Imaginary Voyages of Edgar Allan Poe. The reason we're Kickstarting this project is that we've been asked by several readers if our digital comics will ever be available in printed form. I get that not everyone is a fan of digital comics. Many people (like me) love the feel and smell of the printed page. So we decided to create this campaign and make our first printed comic book extra special. And by extra special, we mean a 28-page book that features a brand-new cover from Emmy-nominated Director/Producer/Illustrator, David Hartman, and a special four-page "Making-Of" section designed by author and illustrator, Tricia Martin. We decided to use Kickstarter so we can cover printing costs and pay our creative team something extra. It's a win-win situation!
Cover by David Hartman
 ABOUT THE BOOK
The Imaginary Voyages of Edgar Allan Poe is a reimagined version of the Harvey and Eagle Award-nominated graphic novel from Image Comics which features a revised script and eye-popping new art by the artist of the Bram Stoker Award-winning Kolchak the Night Stalker: The Forgotten Lore of Edgar Allan Poe, Luis Czerniawski. This is the first of 12 chapters/issues, and if we are successful with this campaign, the plan is to make all 12 issues available as Kickstarter-exclusive printed issues. 
But let's not get ahead of ourselves. 
THE STORY
Edgar Allan Poe has lost everyone he ever loved and now he is losing his mind. Haunted by his wife's ghost and his many literary failures, the poet tumbles into a fantastical world created by his genius...and his madness. This world called Terra Somnium is a nightmare region that merges his macabre literary creations and mythological gods and monsters of old, all hell-bent on stopping him from escaping the land of dreams. 
WHAT IS IT SIMILAR TO?
I've often described this story as "Alice in Wonderland meets The Lord of the Rings." And for those who are fans of classic literature like myself, I would describe it as "Homer's Odyssey meets Dante's Divine Comedy." 
INTERIOR ART: 
Page 1
  Page 2
  Page 3
 ENDORSEMENTS...
"Twisted and ominous, yet rich and charming. MacPherson has crafted a complex and enchanting story that blends the macabre and mythological into a strange dream land that is worthy of the great poet and author, Edgar Allan Poe." - American McGee, Creator and Designer of AMERICAN MCGEE'S ALICE, ALICE: MADNESS RETURNS, and GRIMM
"A beautiful and bizarre adventure into wonder, quirky, lovely and fascinating!" - Kurt Busiek, Multiple Eisner Award-winning creator of ASTRO CITY 
"Together in one package, two of the great passions of my youth (that didn’t end there); comics and Edgar Allan Poe. A thrilling adventure with beautiful art. More, please!" - Roderick Gordon, Author of the New York Times Bestselling TUNNELS series 
"A glimpse into the enigmatic dreamscape where the great chronicler of mystery and madness, Edgar Allan Poe, meets acclaimed comic creator Dwight L. MacPherson. Readers are in for one wild ride." - Chris Semtner, Internationally Exhibited Artist, Author, and Curator of the Edgar Allan Poe Museum in Richmond, VA

  Printed Book and Art Prints
.

campaign.story:
"The world building is clearly done with passion and dedication ... There’s a vibrant world in here, and the creative team bring it to life deftly."
Oliver Gerlach, Comic Bastards.
"The Demon Archives is a fantastic webcomic. Really good science fiction, high-concept kinda cyberpunk stuff ... I can't recommend the comic enough, it's really good. It's one of the better webcomics out there, in my opinion."
The Awesome Comics Podcast.
Short Description:
After 5 years of publishing The Demon Archives online, we're proud to finally announce we're doing a print run! The Demon Archives: Volume 1- The Battle of Arkjut is a compilation of the prologue and first 3 chapters of the webcomic, brought together into a single bound book. 7x10 inches in size and over 100 full-color pages long, you KNOW you want a copy.
We've made a couple of test copies, and found a great local printer who will do a larger batch, but we need YOUR help to raise the money necessary for their minimum order requirements.
Who We Are:
Daniel Sharp is an MD/PhD student who sometimes wishes he'd picked a career path that didn't involve 14 years of post-bachelor's training. He started writing The Demon Archives in a creative fiction class he took in his senior year of undergrad, regularly bouncing ideas off of his older brother, Nick.
Nick Sharp is a web-developer and programmer at Amazon, which luckily for us means he knows how to build and manage our website, AND has the discretionary income to pay our artist, Seba.
Sebastián Píriz is a freelance artist and illustrator from Argentina who somehow juggles a dozen different projects at once and still finds the time to crank out "warm up" sketches that make Dan and Nick weep in jealousy.
The Goal:
We've done the math, and if we can raise $3500 we can meet the minimum quantity requirements of our printer of choice. By using media mail we can keep shipping costs down, so we've made shipping free for all US backers,and only $10 to Canada, and $20 to the rest of the world.
All the art in the book is already produced and paid for, so literally all that the $3500 has to go to is Kickstarter fees, printing costs and shipping. If we manage to raise more? Well, we'll get to stretch goals in a bit ;)
The Story:
If by some miracle you don't already read the comic (hint, you should, it's free), then a short introduction to the story might be in order.
The Demon Archives is a full-color post-apocalyptic sci-fi graphic novel set in 22nd century Earth, 100 years after World War 3 and the collapse of global civilization.
The story takes place in the new nation-state of Minerva, a high-tech society based around bunkers in Kyrgyzstan that survived the devastation, preserving the knowledge and culture of the past.
We follow our protagonist, Tenzin Dorje, Captain of Minerva's top military squad, the Keleres, and his prototype AI assisstant, Jane, as they embark on a mission to a nearby city under Minerva's protection, Arkjut.
What they discover there will threaten not only the survival of the Keleres (power armor and all!), but Minerva itself.
The Rewards:
Stretch Goals:
$3500 is what we need to make this project a reality, but we have some great ideas for if we can raise more. I'll wait to give you the full details until we meet our basic funding, but I'm thinking fancier books, coloring books with your very own pack of red crayons, printed version of the Nightshade short stories, and more!
EDIT: We've reached 50% funding, and unlocked the announcement of our first stretch goal!
 More will be unlocked as we reach the Main Goal!
Add-ons:
The listed reward tiers not quite got what you want? No worries! If you've pledged at one of the physical tiers ($15 and above, plus shipping) you can simply increase your pledge to account for any mix of the following:
$15 - 8.5x11 inch poster of a chapter cover
$25 - Another copy of the book
$50 - Custom commission by Seba
(So if you have pledged at the $25 tier and want a second copy, just raise your pledge to $50, etc)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The story is already complete, the pages drawn, and test prints made. We've already gotten quotes from a great US-based printer, so we know the costs to expect, and getting our shipment of prints won't run into international shipping issues. All we need is the capital to make a large order and get the best deals, keeping costs down for you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
THE IDEA
After two successful volumes of Speculative Relationships, we are ready to bring our science fiction romance trilogy to a close with this final volume!
In the mid-twentieth century, romance was the most popular genre in comics. Comic publishers produced dozens of titles throughout the 1950s and 60s, and many of the medium’s top artistic talents worked in romance comics. For a number of reasons, romance comics all but died out. But we’re bringing them back with the help of amazing independent comics artists! 
This final volume will be our biggest book yet, featuring more artists than ever before. Join us as we explore love, connection, and the limits of speculative fiction! 
THE BOOK 
Comics are best enjoyed in book form. We plan to release another beautiful book, 6”x9”, perfect bound, offset printed, 180 pages, black and white, with a color cover. This will fit perfectly on the shelf with volumes 1 & 2, making a wonderful collection of sci-fi romance comics to be enjoyed for years to come. 
THE ARTISTS 
Just like the first two volumes, we have gathered a diverse group of independent comics creators to share their visions with you. Volumes 1 & 2 featured some of the most incredible new creators in comics, and many of them have continued on to become some of the top talent working today. We strongly encourage you to check out this volume, as we are sure that we have found another batch of comic creators with bright futures! With 19 creators, this will be the largest number we’ve showcased yet. 
 Barrett Stanley, “Priorities” 
The work of Barrett Stanley of Greensboro, NC is imbued with a sense of fun and rendered in meticulous line work. He’s already a veteran of one successful Kickstarter campaign for Heartbreak Quadrant, his fun and stylish action sci-fi comic. 
 heartbreakquadrant.tumblr.com, instagram@barrettcomics 
John Vestevich, “Kill Me If You Can” 
Currently living in Michigan (after a short but welcome stint in Chicago), John is constantly pushing his work into new territories. His comics are marked by experimentation, humor, and stylistic variation. We recommend you check out his mini comics Partners, a. afarensis, and Smelly Hippy Comics. 
www.johnvestevich.com, twitter@JohnVestevich, instagram@johnvestevich 
Drew, of Meaty Comics, “Lunar Tryst” 
Currently living in New York City, Drew is a graduate of Ringling College of Art and Design. His work has a firm grounding in figure drawing, but with the kinetic feeling of 80’s action movies and martial arts films. His knack for creating mood and portraying movement have wowed us ever since first seeing his work. 
twitter@meatycomics, Instagram@meatycomics 
Max & Morrow Dowdle, “Starscape” 
Max is the artist behind the successfully Kickstartered comics Shattered with a Curve of Horn and An Unlikely Refugee. His work showcases beautifully rendered figures and mind-bending plots. Check out his work! 
twitter@maxdowdle, instagram@maxdowdle, MaxDowdle.com 
Landis Blair, “A Toasted Passion” 
The unicycle-riding, bow-tie wearing, cross-hatching genius Landis Blair currently lives in Chicago, IL. Most recently, Landis completed illustrating The Hunting Accident, a huge comic volume to be released by First Second books next year. Additionally, Landis regularly creates twisted dark humor mini comics reminiscent of Edward Gorey. 
twitter@LandisBlair, instagram@landisblair, www.landisblair.com 
 Beck Kramer, “Reprise” 
Beck is another Chicago comicker. She's already been doing a wonderful sci-fi romance comic online called Relativity, exploring what happens to a relationship when FTL travel is involved. Her work is subtle and precise, warranting repeat readings. 
twitter@beckkramer, relativitycomic.com, beckkramer.com 
 M.L. MacDonald, “Blood and Stars” 
Joining us from Canada is drawing virtuoso Alchemichael. We were wowed by his work in on Heart of Weirdness and excited to see him contributing to Island from Image comics. His clean and detailed work brings to mind Moebius and Enki Bilal. 
twitter@Alchemichael77, instagram@alchemichael, alchemichael.tumblr.com 
Amara Leipzig, “Trustband” 
Amara is the creator of experimental comics Other Side, Night Blanket, and The Fifth Window (from Kilgore books). Their work is both meditative and exploratory, reading almost like a poem written in physics. Amara is an alumni of Speculative Relationships Vol 2. 
instagram@amaraleipzig, amaraleipzig.tumblr.com, www.amaraleipzig.com 
Kawai Shen, “La Dame Bleue” 
Both a comics artist and pundit, Kawai’s work explores the surreal, erotic, philosophical aspects of comics. Her clean line style and wonderful prose can be seen in The Book of Mutations & Kawai’s Guide to Cat Calling. Her story for Volume 3 is written in memory of fashion icon Isabella Blow. 
twitter@kawaishen, cutejuicecomics.com 
 M.R. Trower, “I've Got You” 
An alumni of Volume 2, M.R. Trower hails from North Carolina and is the creator of the beautiful comics REM & Bad Dog. Their comics feature unique narratives which explore identity and challenge oppressive societal structures. M.R. is also the curator of anthology zines The Future and Encounters. 
twitter@inkmaggot, Remcomic.tumblr.com, Mrtrower.com 
 Roxanne Palmer, “Action At A Distance” 
Former science journalist for the International Business Times, Roxanne is currently a student of the Sequential Arts Workshop in Gainesville, FL. Her work draws inspiration from science, but that doesn't stop her from drawing some fantastic monsters. 
twitter@redrawnoxen, roxydrew.tumblr.com 
Kitty Curran, “Meanwhile, Deep in the Heart of the Evil Empire...” 
Formerly from ‘across the pond’ in England, Kitty now resides in good ol’ Chicago. Her work is playful and elegant, reminding us of classic romance and the best children’s books of our youth. She is the co-creator and illustrator of the uber-successful mega-hilarious Taylor Swift: Girl Detective. 
twitter@kittycurran, kittycurran.tumblr.com 
Will Tempest, “Distance” 
Will’s art has appeared in Zero and Material, both from Image Comics. He has also worked with Liam Cobb and Tom Kemp on the beautiful risographed anthology Silica Burn. His work is precise as he builds worlds of interesting creatures and environments. We’re stoked to have him on board, representing the UK! 
Instagram@willt01, Twitter@Will_Tempest, willtempest.tumblr.com 
Andrew Miscisco, “Harper Infinity” 
Andrew describes himself as a world-builder and that can’t be denied. His work is populated with fantastic beasts and monsters from the mists of a forgotten time. Despite the gritty settings, Andrew’s art is clear, bright, and readable. 
Instagram@andrewmisisco, twitter@AndrewMisisco, andrewmisisco.wixsite.com/misiscoart 
 Matthew Sargent, “Future Roommate” 
Matthew’s work explores many genres, featuring crisp clean cartooning, and a healthy sense of humor. He is most known for his comic Bag Drop, a workplace comedy set on a golf course. 
twitter@mbsargent, instagram@skippinginfinity, skippinginfinity.com
Jacob Bouvet, w/Amanda Johnson & Nikki Sherman, “Dutifully Broken Hearted” 
Bringing some mech-love (cuz who can resist that) is writer Jacob Bouvet, illustrator Amanda Johnson, & letterer Nikki Sherman. This super team of creators is active on the website The Comic Jam. We know you’ll love what they have collaborated on for us! 
twitter@PopFenton (Jacob), jacobbouvet.com, instagram@nyxish (Amanda), twitter@fivxxfive (Nikki)   
Cover by Jose Moreno 
Providing the cover to Speculative Relationships: Volume 3 is the incredible Jose Moreno! Jose is an illustrator and master book-maker living in northern California. His illustrations are immediately striking, featuring unique color palettes and beautiful figures. We think his cover is the perfect closing to our sci-fi romance anthology! 
twitter@jamorenoart, instagram@jamorenoart, www.jamoreno.com 
THE REWARDS 
The Books:
 All 3 volumes of Speculative Relationships are 6"x9", offset printed, perfect bound, with black & white interiors and color covers.  Volume 1 is 80 pages, Volume 2 is 136 pages, and Volume 3 weighs in at an enormous 180 pages of content!
Volume 1 features stories from:
Daniel Warren Johnson
Mike Manomivibul
Isabella Rotman
Rinko Endo
Tyrell Cannon
Scott Kroll
Volume 2 features stories from:
Liam Cobb
Grim Wilkins
Ezra Claytan Daniels w/Ben Passmore
Max & Morrow Dowdle
Rich Foster
Daniel Warren Johnson
Beck Kramer
Amara Leipzig
Mike Manomivibul
Isabella Rotman
M.R. Trower
Kat Verhoeven
Tyrell Cannon
Scott Kroll
None of these stories are available anywhere else!
...
The Prints:
We've had some incredible cover artists involved in Speculative Relationships, including Mike Manomivibul (volume 1), Sandra Lanz (volume 2), and Jose Moreno (volume 3).  Each cover image is printed sans-logo, so you can appreciate the beautiful art on its own.  All are 8.5"x11", digital prints, on heavy paper stock. 
Tyrell Cannon's print was created specifically for this final volume's campaign and has not been released before!  It is printed to the same specifications as the other prints, so they can all be displayed side by side.
...
The Making Love zine:
Our "Making Love" zines have been a fan favorite since Volume 1.  It's your behind the scenes look into the work that goes into creating comics and putting together an anthology.  You'll see sketches from the artists, thumbnails for pages, preliminary designs for the cover, and even some candid email exchanges. The zines are printed old school on black & white xerox machines, then hand-bound and numbered by the editors.  
Kawai Shen Postcards:
SR3 artist Kawai Shen has presented an intimate reward for you with two tantalizing postcards.  Each pair is scented with one of her favourite niche perfumes, all murderously expensive.  She will personalize one card per backer, including a small (naughty?) drawing on the back.  Only 5 rewards available! 
The PDFs
We give you high resolution, DRM-free PDFs for easy sharing across all your reading devices in the household.  
WHERE THE MONEY GOES 
The money is all for printing the book, backer rewards, and shipping. And then some extra to go to Kickstarter & Amazon (as usual). Much like our last campaign, we feel that money raised in excess of our goal should be passed on to the artists, as compensation for creating these wonderful stories (all artists have created their stories for FREE). We have a few stretch goals in mind, all of which will enhance the book. Think spot varnish, embossing, rich black inks, and individual book numbers! We are excited to be working with a well-established and Kickstarter experienced printer: Print Ninja. With their help we hope to bring you the best quality book possible. The books will be printed overseas, so this will make the expected delivery a little further out than a U.S. printer, but we think it’ll be worth the wait.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Getting proofs of the book and making it look JUST RIGHT for our backers is very important, so that process could possibly take longer than expected. However, we plan to work our hardest to minimize any delays.
We learned a lot on our last two campaigns regarding shipping. Additionally, we have quite a few Kickstarter vets in our book who have also given us lots of helpful advice to make our processes as efficient as possible. Again, the delivery will be slightly delayed compared to our previous campaigns, as we wait for books to arrive from out of the country. However, this wait is completely normal and we will communicate expected delivery dates as clearly as we can as details develop.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
From Nothing, Something comes. Espers is a creation mythology. Most fantasy stories begin in the waning days of magical power, at their height, or on some damn crusade to reclaim a lost era. This story isn't that. This story is a beginning. This is a comic of Genesis. There was nothing, not even void. There was only the infinite regress, and his name...was Lotin, the great serpent. 
      Chris Lewis Lee, Miles Greb, And Melissa Pagluica
Miles Greb - Writer, Creator, Producer - Former Bob Dylan impersonator whose love of Star Trek is annoying to everyone.
Chris Lewis Lee- Lead Artist - English countryside dweller.
Melissa Pagluica - Cover Artist -  Tea-loving, cat-wielding creator of the comic book Above the Clouds.
Xavier Merced - Pixel Art Cover Artist - Purveyor of fine clusters. Finest pixel artist in the realm...Rivals Miles in his love for Final Fantasy Tactics.

AML#2 is a 28 page sci fi/ action/ adventure story. It follows directly on from #1 as the agents track their quarry deep into the jungles surrounding their walled off city. Lands unexplored for generations, overgrown and unseen. What they face as unknown as it is mysterious and dangerous.
What awaits them as they venture into this unknown territory? What monsters might they find?
The book itself is 100% complete. Interior artwork and book design done. This campaign is entirely to fund the printing costs involved. It will be a short print run with some bonus rewards for backers. More to come should the funding to go over its goal.
This is the second of a planned four book arc. Each book focusing on a specific character of the team and their unique talent.
The art and story in this book is created entirely by me, Matthew Hoddy. It is a love letter to the show I watched on early morning TV growing up. From Robotech to M.A.S.K. to Swat Kats.
A self published author & illustrator. I live in Toronto, Canada. But hail from Brisbane Australia. A lover of all things sci fi, including giant robots & monsters as well as giant robots punching monsters.
Previous books published via crowd funding or otherwise:
-Space Pyrates vol 1, 2 & epilogue (web & printed)
-Saga of Metalbeard #1, #1.5 (web & printed)
-AML #1 (printed)
Following is four pages from the story itself to give you an idea of the interior art and storytelling. This book is different from the first in that it is full colour. Issue one was majority black & white with some colour.
All the artwork was created by Matthew Hoddy. From rough storyboards, through to pencils, inks and colours.

Hey everybody! We are over $9k and as a thank you we now have a free bookmark for all physical backers and stickers designed by Julian available. If you want to add the stickers to your order (physical backers only please), add $8 to your pledge and you will receive six 3" vinyl stickers. We still have 40 hours to go and we are $1000 away from our next goal, a pin designed by Julian.

Free bookmark designed by Paul Rigg for all physical backers
  At $8500 this illustration will be printed as a 5x7 mini print and FREE for every backer at a physical level. This will be a limited print exclusively for the kickstarter. Thanks to Chris Lewis Lee for the beautiful illustration.
Galahad and the Far-Off Horizon is a 130 page collection of five stories, set in a fantastical world of witches, golems, and magical creatures. I've had the pleasure of working with some of my favorite artists over the past two years in bringing these stories to fruition, and - with your help - we'll be all set to take this anthology to print.
I owe many thanks to Chan Chau, Julian Adkins, John Adkins, Maria Frantz, Julie Godwin and Devin Kraft for helping make this project a reality. Their hard work and dedication can be seen in every single page of this book. Each of them brings a unique art style to the book, and it's fascinating to see their different interpretations of the character designs. I have linked their names to their previous work, so you can have and idea of what to expect in the anthology.
Below is a small preview of what they've created for Galahad and the Far-Off Horizon. As our campaign progresses, we will showcase each artist and what they've brought to the project.
   The beautiful wrap-around cover was painted by Julian Adkins, and Emily Osborne designed the vibrant endpapers. 
    The Garden of Galahad is a story about love and dedication. Galahad, an enchanted suit of armor, carries out the wishes of its master until the young witch Brynne interrupts its peaceful routine. Over hills, by seasides and past the ruins of old castles, the pair embark on the journey of a lifetime. Julian Adkins beautifully illustrates these pages with flatting assists by John Adkins. This story is 49 pages long and introduces the world in which all the following stories are set. Click here for a preview of the first ten pages.
   The four short stories, illustrated by Chan, Devin, Maria, and Julie, explore the backgrounds of key characters before The Garden of Galahad and help flesh out the world they live in. 
The Witches Laugh (8 pages) introduces us to a powerful coven.
Broken Keep (14 pages) looks back at the early life of Galahad's creator, Lance.
Tougher Than The Hills (26 pages) uncovers a mistake Brynne made in her youth.
When Magic Was Free (14 pages) details the tragic beginning of the series antagonist.
Along with the five stories that comprise the anthology, there are companion illustrations and a character gallery featuring artwork from some amazing folks. I'll be posting a few of these as the campaign rolls on. 
Digital and printed versions of Galahad and the Far-Off Horizon, as well as several different digital bundles are available now. 
There's also some extra goodies to choose from - postcards and posters - if you'd like even more of Galahad and the Far-Off Horizon in your life.
The wonderful Meredith McClaren has donated 20 hardcover copies of Hinges Book 1: Clockwork City. This is beautiful book collects the first chapter of Meredith's webcomic and each copy is signed and sketched.Grab one while you can! We are so very greatful for Meredith's donation and her support of our project.
As a thank you for your support in this project I am making two mini comics I've written, Adventures in Nate's Perilous Challenge illustrated by Jack Gross and Mother Made us to Die illustrated by Marek Jarocki available to all physical backers at $5 for the pair. You can click through on the titles and see a preview. Just add $5 to your pledge with a physical reward and both of these comics are yours!
We also have two original art tiers from Christa Dippel and Kristeen Parmeter and one digital commission from Julian Adkins, so be quick to jump on those if you're interested. These are available for international shipping as soon as the campaign launches.  
  As you can see, most of the Kickstarter funds will be dedicated to printing, with a couple thousand going to Kickstarter fees and shipping out rewards. We are not relying on funding to pay the artists; they have been compensated prior to the campaign. However, if the Kickstarter is funded beyond all of the stretch goals (i.e. past $20,000), a portion of the excess funds will be divided among the creators.
   Thank you so much for reading all the way through this. I appreciate your support and I cannot wait to have these print copies in my hand and in the mail to you.

campaign.story:
I wanted to share my love of horror movie monsters in a way that others would find fun and entertaining. Putting together a poker deck of cards allowed me to draw a lot of monsters, allow for anyone to have an entire collection in the palm of their hand, and make it easy to share the fun with others. My goal is for people to use these cards to share their film-viewing experiences, laugh at some of the hilarious monster designs, and arouse their curiosity enough that they track down and watch a movie they might have missed. And it all starts with this deck of obscure movie monster playing cards.
What do I get for backing this?
You will receive an entertaining pack of playing cards featuring illustrations of obscure movie monsters. It could be that you’ve seen one or two of these creepy creatures. You’ll quickly be captivated as you flip through the cards. You may begin playing with the monsters before you start playing a game. Can you remember where and when you saw that green thing? Is it an old creature feature of the fifties or something more recent? As you flip through the cards, you will have the urge to compare your movie trivia with others. Their laughter is your reward as you share these maligned movie monsters. 
Stretch Goal Rewards
Because of various stretch goals being achieved supporters will also receive: Four screen savers done by guest artists, and a set of four Horror Movie Bingo Cards. These will go out to all supporters on all reward levels. Scroll to the bottom to see what stretch goal is underway.
Card Specs: Cards will be 300 gsm with blue core and smooth finish.
Examples from the deck and the front of the card.
 Tuck Pack: All decks at all reward levels will come in a tuck pack.
Tuck Pack Design for Obscure Movie Monster Playing Cards
For those who just can’t get enough of movie monsters, there are multiple reward tiers for your backing pleasure. All of the reward tiers include a pack of our uniquely gruesome cards. There are early bird specials for those who commit early, as well as unique offerings that will be made only for this Kickstarter. Select from multi-packs, book add-ons, prints, original art and much more, for a custom-tailored combination of rewards just for you.
Wow! this project has taken off. There are several award options listed below, so please keep scrolling to see them all. But first, this update: 
Several backers have requested that I provide the option of them being able to add one or more decks to their reward level. Some of the award levels have more than one deck, but must are defaulted with just one. So here are the instructions for adding more decks to your pledge.
Add-On Instructions: To add an add-on to your pledge, follow these steps:
1) Press the ‘Manage Your Pledge’ button on the project’s page.
2) Increase your pledge by the amount needed to claim your add-on(s).
3) Save your pledge. Do not change the tier that you originally pledge at. 4) After the campaign ends, you will receive a survey that will ask you questions about how you would like the add-on money assigned.
These add-ons will cover the additional reward and shipping:

updates.update_content:
The Obscure Movie Monster Playing Cards and Horror Movie Bingo Cards create by this campaign are available at my online store - CLICK HERE. 
Several of you have written back to me asking if additional decks are available. You've shown your deck to friends and family and now they want one too. Yes! Both the decks and the cards are available. If you are a game store or game distributor please contact me directly for bulk purchase inquiries. I do have wholesaler rates available upon request.

Except for half a dozen supporters who haven't provided their address on the survey all of my supporters have either received their awards or have packages in the mail. Now it's time for me to do the math and see if everything balances out. 
Maybe I should have used Kickstarter to create the Horror Movie Bingo Cards. As it was I use my own funds to produce them with the hopes that including them in this campaign would even out. But I just couldn't resist adding them to the campaign. Doing so forced me to complete the art for the project before the campaign ended.

updates.update_userinfo: Except for a few strays, fulfillment is complete!
updates.update_content:
Nearly all supporters have been sent their decks. The exceptions are reward levels which include original art, or prints. I've saved those for last as some of the prints need to be redone, and I need to find an alternative supply for hard envelopes and tubes. Please excuse the delay.
The largest shipment went out in today's mail [mainly 2nd Mouse awards]. But, I did start the mailing process over a week ago. Many of you have already reported receiving your package. Nearly all the packages in the USA were sent Media rate, so please be patient.

I goofed when I put out the surveys. I promised that I would have a checkbox for those who had added more funds unto their reward level in order to get more decks. I forgot and left that off. Kickstarter doesn't allow you to do surveys twice. Since only a few backers took me up on that I will be closely looking at the contributions to see which are higher than they should be at that level. You can help me out be sending me an direct message reminding me of your desired add-ons. I'll check the amount and process the fulfillment.
I'm setting the end of Thursday as the deadline for the the unanswered surveys to come in. I have to do this as Kickstarter will only give me the billing addresses once the survey switch for address updates is switched off. Otherwise I only see the survey addresses and blank spaces for folks who didn't fill out the survey.

The printer sent me a deck to proof. The color looked good, the feel was good, but I saw a major error. The Jokers still had the FPO text on them and not the final credits from backers. I've asked the printer about this and I'm waiting a reply. With any luck it will get sorted out in a few days. I was hoping to get the decks before the Lilac City Comicon, but that might not happen.
This means folks who are late in hearing the news can still get in on pre-orders at my store website.

Well, this is a big step. I spent the day reviewing the files. Making sure that there weren't duplicates. Confirming that corrections were made. Back when the campaign was under way I did a test run of just few packs. I needed to make sure the color was working, that I liked the feel. This was before the stretch goal of improved paper was reached. Once the I'd triple checked everything and added names to the Jokers I pulled the trigger. It will take between nine to eleven business days before the decks arrive here. 
I'm halfway done with the customized Jokers that some very kind fans asked for. Once that art is complete I can add it to the book. I also need to write some copy for those Jokers to go into the book. Once done I'll arrange for it to be available to supporters.

updates.update_userinfo: Caught A Mistake On Press Check
updates.update_content:
Good News! This morning I found $5,478.80 added to my account. A percentage of the  goes to Kickstarter for offering the service. And there are always those who back a reward but who's cards were declined. So this is roughly the amount I anticipated hitting the bank. 
I've sent out survey questions to those who opted for the "credit in the deck" award. I set a deadline of this Wednesday for them to get back to me with a name change, if they have one. My goal is to send out the order for the decks on Thursday.
